response.description: The surah that declares that God bears witness that the false profession of faith by The Hypocrites is uttered only as a screen to hide their duplicity. It takes its name from its main topic, “the hypocrites” (munāfiqūn). The surah warns the believers about the treachery of the hypocrites and describes their behaviour in some detail. A specific occasion on which the hypocrites tried to stop anyone donating money to believers is described (verse 7 .) and God calls on the Muslims to compensate for this by giving more of their own funds to the needy (verse 9 .).

1.content: إِذا جاءَكَ المُنافِقونَ قالوا نَشهَدُ إِنَّكَ لَرَسولُ اللَّهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ إِنَّكَ لَرَسولُهُ وَاللَّهُ يَشهَدُ إِنَّ المُنافِقينَ لَكاذِبونَ
1.translation_eng: When the hypocrites come to youthey say, ‘We bear witnessthat you are indeed the apostle of Allah.’Allah knows that you are indeed His Apostle,and Allah bears witness thatthe hypocrites are indeed liars.
1.transliteration: ʾidhā jāʾaka l-munāfiqūna qālū nashhadu ʾinnaka la-rasūlu llāhi wa-llāhu yaʿlamu ʾinnaka la-rasūluhū wa-llāhu yashhadu ʾinna l-munāfiqīna la-kādhibūna

2.content: اتَّخَذوا أَيمانَهُم جُنَّةً فَصَدّوا عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُم ساءَ ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
2.translation_eng: They make a shield of their oaths,and bar from the way of Allah.Evil indeed is what they used to do.
2.transliteration: ittakhadhū ʾaymānahum junnatan fa-ṣaddū ʿan sabīli llāhi ʾinnahum sāʾa mā kānū yaʿmalūna

3.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُم آمَنوا ثُمَّ كَفَروا فَطُبِعَ عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم فَهُم لا يَفقَهونَ
3.translation_eng: That is because they believed and then disbelieved,so their hearts were sealed.Hence they do not understand.
3.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾannahum ʾāmanū thumma kafarū fa-ṭubiʿa ʿalā qulūbihim fa-hum lā yafqahūna

4.content: ۞ وَإِذا رَأَيتَهُم تُعجِبُكَ أَجسامُهُم ۖ وَإِن يَقولوا تَسمَع لِقَولِهِم ۖ كَأَنَّهُم خُشُبٌ مُسَنَّدَةٌ ۖ يَحسَبونَ كُلَّ صَيحَةٍ عَلَيهِم ۚ هُمُ العَدُوُّ فَاحذَرهُم ۚ قاتَلَهُمُ اللَّهُ ۖ أَنّىٰ يُؤفَكونَ
4.translation_eng: When you see them, their bodies impress you,and if they speak, you listen to their speech.Yet they are like dry logs set reclining [against a wall].They suppose every cry is directed against them.They are the enemy, so beware of them.May Allah assail them, where do they stray?!
4.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā raʾaytahum tuʿjibuka ʾajsāmuhum wa-ʾin yaqūlū tasmaʿ li-qawlihim ka-ʾannahum khushubun musannadatun yaḥsabūna kulla ṣayḥatin ʿalayhim humu l-ʿaduwwu fa-ḥdharhum qātalahumu llāhu ʾannā yuʾfakūna

5.content: وَإِذا قيلَ لَهُم تَعالَوا يَستَغفِر لَكُم رَسولُ اللَّهِ لَوَّوا رُءوسَهُم وَرَأَيتَهُم يَصُدّونَ وَهُم مُستَكبِرونَ
5.translation_eng: When they are told, ‘Come,that Allah’s Apostle may plead for forgiveness for you,’they twist their heads,and you see them turn away while they are disdainful.
5.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā qīla lahum taʿālaw yastaghfir lakum rasūlu llāhi lawwaw ruʾūsahum wa-raʾaytahum yaṣuddūna wa-hum mustakbirūna

6.content: سَواءٌ عَلَيهِم أَستَغفَرتَ لَهُم أَم لَم تَستَغفِر لَهُم لَن يَغفِرَ اللَّهُ لَهُم ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدِي القَومَ الفاسِقينَ
6.translation_eng: It is the same for themwhether you plead for forgiveness for them,or do not plead for forgiveness for them:Allah will never forgive them.Indeed Allah does not guide the transgressing lot.
6.transliteration: sawāʾun ʿalayhim ʾa-staghfarta lahum ʾam lam tastaghfir lahum lan yaghfira llāhu lahum ʾinna llāha lā yahdī l-qawma l-fāsiqīna

7.content: هُمُ الَّذينَ يَقولونَ لا تُنفِقوا عَلىٰ مَن عِندَ رَسولِ اللَّهِ حَتّىٰ يَنفَضّوا ۗ وَلِلَّهِ خَزائِنُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَلٰكِنَّ المُنافِقينَ لا يَفقَهونَ
7.translation_eng: They are the ones who say, ‘Do not spendon those who are with the Apostle of Allahuntil they scatter off.’Yet to Allah belong the treasuries of the heavensand the earth,but the hypocrites do not understand.
7.transliteration: humu lladhīna yaqūlūna lā tunfiqū ʿalā man ʿinda rasūli llāhi ḥattā yanfaḍḍū wa-li-llāhi khazāʾinu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-lākinna l-munāfiqīna lā yafqahūna

8.content: يَقولونَ لَئِن رَجَعنا إِلَى المَدينَةِ لَيُخرِجَنَّ الأَعَزُّ مِنهَا الأَذَلَّ ۚ وَلِلَّهِ العِزَّةُ وَلِرَسولِهِ وَلِلمُؤمِنينَ وَلٰكِنَّ المُنافِقينَ لا يَعلَمونَ
8.translation_eng: They say, ‘When we return to the city,the mighty will surely expel the abased from it.’1Yet all might belongs to Allah and His Apostle,and the faithful,but the hypocrites do not know.Or, ‘the mighty will surely expel the weak from it.’
8.transliteration: yaqūlūna la-ʾin rajaʿnā ʾilā l-madīnati la-yukhrijanna l-ʾaʿazzu minhā l-ʾadhalla wa-li-llāhi l-ʿizzatu wa-li-rasūlihī wa-li-l-muʾminīna wa-lākinna l-munāfiqīna lā yaʿlamūna

9.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تُلهِكُم أَموالُكُم وَلا أَولادُكُم عَن ذِكرِ اللَّهِ ۚ وَمَن يَفعَل ذٰلِكَ فَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الخاسِرونَ
9.translation_eng: O you who have faith!Do not let your possessions and children distract youfrom the remembrance of Allah,and whoever does that—it is they who are the losers.
9.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū lā tulhikum ʾamwālukum wa-lā ʾawlādukum ʿan dhikri llāhi wa-man yafʿal dhālika fa-ʾulāʾika humu l-khāsirūna

10.content: وَأَنفِقوا مِن ما رَزَقناكُم مِن قَبلِ أَن يَأتِيَ أَحَدَكُمُ المَوتُ فَيَقولَ رَبِّ لَولا أَخَّرتَني إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ قَريبٍ فَأَصَّدَّقَ وَأَكُن مِنَ الصّالِحينَ
10.translation_eng: Spend from what We have provided youbefore death comes to any of you,whereat he will say, ‘My Lord,why did You not respite me for a short timeso that I might have given charityand become one of the righteous!’
10.transliteration: wa-ʾanfiqū min mā razaqnākum min qabli ʾan yaʾtiya ʾaḥadakumu l-mawtu fa-yaqūla rabbi law-lā ʾakhkhartanī ʾilā ʾajalin qarībin fa-ʾaṣṣaddaqa wa-ʾakun mina ṣ-ṣāliḥīna

11.content: وَلَن يُؤَخِّرَ اللَّهُ نَفسًا إِذا جاءَ أَجَلُها ۚ وَاللَّهُ خَبيرٌ بِما تَعمَلونَ
11.translation_eng: But Allah shall never respite a soulwhen its time has come,and Allah is well aware of what you do.
11.transliteration: wa-lan yuʾakhkhira llāhu nafsan ʾidhā jāʾa ʾajaluhā wa-llāhu khabīrun bi-mā taʿmalūna

response.description: The surah that declares that God absolves of misdeeds, and sets right the intellects, of those who work righteousness and who believe in all that God has sent down upon His final Messenger to humankind, Muḥammad. It takes its name from verse 2, where the name of the Prophet occurs. The surah deals with issues of war, those who try to prevent conversion to Islam and the carrying out of God’s commands, and the fate of the hypocrites. It specifically mentions the iniquity of those who expelled the Prophet from Mecca, it describes the futility of the disbelievers’ attempts to oppose God and His Prophet, and it urges the Muslims to obey God in all matters, lest their good deeds come to nothing on the Day of Judgement like those of the disbelievers and hypocrites.The surah is also known as: Mohammad, Muhammad (the Prophet).

1.content: الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَصَدّوا عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ أَضَلَّ أَعمالَهُم
1.translation_eng: Those who are [themselves] faithlessand bar [others] from the way of Allah—He has made their works go awry.
1.transliteration: alladhīna kafarū wa-ṣaddū ʿan sabīli llāhi ʾaḍalla ʾaʿmālahum

2.content: وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ وَآمَنوا بِما نُزِّلَ عَلىٰ مُحَمَّدٍ وَهُوَ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّهِم ۙ كَفَّرَ عَنهُم سَيِّئَاتِهِم وَأَصلَحَ بالَهُم
2.translation_eng: But those who have faith and do righteous deedsand believe in what has been sent downto Muhammad —and it is the truth from their Lord—He shall absolve them of their misdeedsand set right their affairs.
2.transliteration: wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti wa-ʾāmanū bi-mā nuzzila ʿalā muḥammadin wa-huwa l-ḥaqqu min rabbihim kaffara ʿanhum sayyiʾātihim wa-ʾaṣlaḥa bālahum

3.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَرُوا اتَّبَعُوا الباطِلَ وَأَنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنُوا اتَّبَعُوا الحَقَّ مِن رَبِّهِم ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يَضرِبُ اللَّهُ لِلنّاسِ أَمثالَهُم
3.translation_eng: That is because the faithlessfollow falsehood,and because the faithful follow the truthfrom their Lord.That is how Allah draws comparisons for mankind.
3.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾanna lladhīna kafarū ttabaʿū l-bāṭila wa-ʾanna lladhīna ʾāmanū ttabaʿū l-ḥaqqa min rabbihim ka-dhālika yaḍribu llāhu li-n-nāsi ʾamthālahum

4.content: فَإِذا لَقيتُمُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا فَضَربَ الرِّقابِ حَتّىٰ إِذا أَثخَنتُموهُم فَشُدُّوا الوَثاقَ فَإِمّا مَنًّا بَعدُ وَإِمّا فِداءً حَتّىٰ تَضَعَ الحَربُ أَوزارَها ۚ ذٰلِكَ وَلَو يَشاءُ اللَّهُ لَانتَصَرَ مِنهُم وَلٰكِن لِيَبلُوَ بَعضَكُم بِبَعضٍ ۗ وَالَّذينَ قُتِلوا في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ فَلَن يُضِلَّ أَعمالَهُم
4.translation_eng: When you meet the faithless in battle,strike their necks.When you have thoroughly decimated them,bind the captives firmly.Thereafter either oblige them [by setting them free]or take ransomtill the war lays down its burdens.That [is Allah’s ordinance],and had Allah wishedHe could have taken vengeance on them,1but that He may test some of you by means of others.As for those who were slain in the way of Allah,He will not let their works go awry.That is, without your mediation.
4.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā laqītumu lladhīna kafarū fa-ḍarba r-riqābi ḥattā ʾidhā ʾathkhantumūhum fa-shuddū l-wathāqa fa-ʾimmā mannan baʿdu wa-ʾimmā fidāʾan ḥattā taḍaʿa l-ḥarbu ʾawzārahā dhālika wa-law yashāʾu llāhu la-ntaṣara minhum wa-lākin li-yabluwa baʿḍakum bi-baʿḍin wa-lladhīna qutilū fī sabīli llāhi fa-lan yuḍilla ʾaʿmālahum

5.translation_eng: He will guide them and set right their affairs,

6.translation_eng: and admit them into paradisewith which He has acquainted them.

7.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا إِن تَنصُرُوا اللَّهَ يَنصُركُم وَيُثَبِّت أَقدامَكُم
7.translation_eng: O you who have faith!If you help Allah, He will help youand make your feet steady.
7.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾin tanṣurū llāha yanṣurkum wa-yuthabbit ʾaqdāmakum

8.content: وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا فَتَعسًا لَهُم وَأَضَلَّ أَعمالَهُم
8.translation_eng: As for the faithless,their lot will be to fall [into ruin],1and He will make their works go awry.Or ‘their lot will be wretchedness.’
8.transliteration: wa-lladhīna kafarū fa-taʿsan lahum wa-ʾaḍalla ʾaʿmālahum

9.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُم كَرِهوا ما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ فَأَحبَطَ أَعمالَهُم
9.translation_eng: That is because they loathedwhat Allah has sent down,so He made their works fail.
9.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾannahum karihū mā ʾanzala llāhu fa-ʾaḥbaṭa ʾaʿmālahum

10.content: ۞ أَفَلَم يَسيروا فِي الأَرضِ فَيَنظُروا كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم ۚ دَمَّرَ اللَّهُ عَلَيهِم ۖ وَلِلكافِرينَ أَمثالُها
10.translation_eng: Have they not travelled over the landso that they may observehow was the fate of those who were before them?Allah destroyed them,and a similar [fate] awaits the faithless.
10.transliteration: ʾa-fa-lam yasīrū fī l-ʾarḍi fa-yanẓurū kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu lladhīna min qablihim dammara llāhu ʿalayhim wa-li-l-kāfirīna ʾamthāluhā

11.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ مَولَى الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَأَنَّ الكافِرينَ لا مَولىٰ لَهُم
11.translation_eng: That is because Allah is the protector of the faithful,and because the faithless have no protector.
11.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾanna llāha mawlā lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʾanna l-kāfirīna lā mawlā lahum

12.content: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُدخِلُ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ جَنّاتٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ ۖ وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا يَتَمَتَّعونَ وَيَأكُلونَ كَما تَأكُلُ الأَنعامُ وَالنّارُ مَثوًى لَهُم
12.translation_eng: Indeed Allah will admit those who have faithand do righteous deedsinto gardens with streams running in them.As for the faithless, they enjoy and eatjust like the cattle eat,and the Fire will be their [final] abode.
12.transliteration: ʾinna llāha yudkhilu lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru wa-lladhīna kafarū yatamattaʿūna wa-yaʾkulūna ka-mā taʾkulu l-ʾanʿāmu wa-n-nāru mathwan lahum

13.content: وَكَأَيِّن مِن قَريَةٍ هِيَ أَشَدُّ قُوَّةً مِن قَريَتِكَ الَّتي أَخرَجَتكَ أَهلَكناهُم فَلا ناصِرَ لَهُم
13.translation_eng: How many a town there has beenwhich was more powerful than your townwhich expelled you,which We have destroyed,and they had no helper.
13.transliteration: wa-ka-ʾayyin min qaryatin hiya ʾashaddu quwwatan min qaryatika llatī ʾakhrajatka ʾahlaknāhum fa-lā nāṣira lahum

14.content: أَفَمَن كانَ عَلىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِن رَبِّهِ كَمَن زُيِّنَ لَهُ سوءُ عَمَلِهِ وَاتَّبَعوا أَهواءَهُم
14.translation_eng: Is he who stands on a manifest proof from his Lordlike someoneto whom the evil of his conduct is made to seem decorous,and who follow their desires?
14.transliteration: ʾa-fa-man kāna ʿalā bayyinatin min rabbihī ka-man zuyyina lahū sūʾu ʿamalihī wa-ttabaʿū ʾahwāʾahum

15.content: مَثَلُ الجَنَّةِ الَّتي وُعِدَ المُتَّقونَ ۖ فيها أَنهارٌ مِن ماءٍ غَيرِ آسِنٍ وَأَنهارٌ مِن لَبَنٍ لَم يَتَغَيَّر طَعمُهُ وَأَنهارٌ مِن خَمرٍ لَذَّةٍ لِلشّارِبينَ وَأَنهارٌ مِن عَسَلٍ مُصَفًّى ۖ وَلَهُم فيها مِن كُلِّ الثَّمَراتِ وَمَغفِرَةٌ مِن رَبِّهِم ۖ كَمَن هُوَ خالِدٌ فِي النّارِ وَسُقوا ماءً حَميمًا فَقَطَّعَ أَمعاءَهُم
15.translation_eng: A description of the paradisepromised to the Godwary:therein are streams of unstaling water,and streams of milk unchanging in flavour,and streams of wine delicious to the drinkers,and streams of purified honey;there will be for them every kind of fruit in it,and forgiveness from their Lord.[Are such ones] like those who abide in the Fireand are given to drink boiling waterwhich cuts up their bowels?
15.transliteration: mathalu l-jannati llatī wuʿida l-muttaqūna fīhā ʾanhārun min māʾin ghayri ʾāsinin wa-ʾanhārun min labanin lam yataghayyar ṭaʿmuhū wa-ʾanhārun min khamrin ladhdhatin li-sh-shāribīna wa-ʾanhārun min ʿasalin muṣaffan wa-lahum fīhā min kulli th-thamarāti wa-maghfiratun min rabbihim ka-man huwa khālidun fī n-nāri wa-suqū māʾan ḥamīman fa-qaṭṭaʿa ʾamʿāʾahum

16.content: وَمِنهُم مَن يَستَمِعُ إِلَيكَ حَتّىٰ إِذا خَرَجوا مِن عِندِكَ قالوا لِلَّذينَ أوتُوا العِلمَ ماذا قالَ آنِفًا ۚ أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ طَبَعَ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم وَاتَّبَعوا أَهواءَهُم
16.translation_eng: There are some among themwho prick up their ears at you.But when they go out from your presence,they say to those who have been given knowledge,‘What did he say just now?’They are the oneson whose hearts Allah has set a seal,and they follow their own desires.
16.transliteration: wa-minhum man yastamiʿu ʾilayka ḥattā ʾidhā kharajū min ʿindika qālū li-lladhīna ʾūtū l-ʿilma mādhā qāla ʾānifan ʾulāʾika lladhīna ṭabaʿa llāhu ʿalā qulūbihim wa-ttabaʿū ʾahwāʾahum

17.content: وَالَّذينَ اهتَدَوا زادَهُم هُدًى وَآتاهُم تَقواهُم
17.translation_eng: As for those who are [rightly] guided,He enhances their guidance,and invests them with their Godwariness.
17.transliteration: wa-lladhīna htadaw zādahum hudan wa-ʾātāhum taqwāhum

18.content: فَهَل يَنظُرونَ إِلَّا السّاعَةَ أَن تَأتِيَهُم بَغتَةً ۖ فَقَد جاءَ أَشراطُها ۚ فَأَنّىٰ لَهُم إِذا جاءَتهُم ذِكراهُم
18.translation_eng: Do they await anything except that the Hourshould overtake them suddenly?Certainly its portents have come.Of what avail to themwill their admonition be when it overtakes them?
18.transliteration: fa-hal yanẓurūna ʾillā s-sāʿata ʾan taʾtiyahum baghtatan fa-qad jāʾa ʾashrāṭuhā fa-ʾannā lahum ʾidhā jāʾathum dhikrāhum

19.content: فَاعلَم أَنَّهُ لا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَاستَغفِر لِذَنبِكَ وَلِلمُؤمِنينَ وَالمُؤمِناتِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ مُتَقَلَّبَكُم وَمَثواكُم
19.translation_eng: Know that there is no god except Allah,and plead [to Allah] for forgiveness of your sinand for the faithful, men and women.Allah knows your itineraryand your [final] abode.
19.transliteration: fa-ʿlam ʾannahū lā ʾilāha ʾillā llāhu wa-staghfir li-dhanbika wa-li-l-muʾminīna wa-l-muʾmināti wa-llāhu yaʿlamu mutaqallabakum wa-mathwākum

20.content: وَيَقولُ الَّذينَ آمَنوا لَولا نُزِّلَت سورَةٌ ۖ فَإِذا أُنزِلَت سورَةٌ مُحكَمَةٌ وَذُكِرَ فيهَا القِتالُ ۙ رَأَيتَ الَّذينَ في قُلوبِهِم مَرَضٌ يَنظُرونَ إِلَيكَ نَظَرَ المَغشِيِّ عَلَيهِ مِنَ المَوتِ ۖ فَأَولىٰ لَهُم
20.translation_eng: The faithful say,‘If only a sūrah were sent down!’But when a definitive sūrah is sent downand war is mentioned in it,you see those in whose hearts is a sickness1looking upon youwith the look of someone fainting at death.So woe to them!That is, the hypocrites.
20.transliteration: wa-yaqūlu lladhīna ʾāmanū law-lā nuzzilat sūratun fa-ʾidhā ʾunzilat sūratun muḥkamatun wa-dhukira fīhā l-qitālu raʾayta lladhīna fī qulūbihim maraḍun yanẓurūna ʾilayka naẓara l-maghshiyyi ʿalayhi mina l-mawti fa-ʾawlā lahum

21.content: طاعَةٌ وَقَولٌ مَعروفٌ ۚ فَإِذا عَزَمَ الأَمرُ فَلَو صَدَقُوا اللَّهَ لَكانَ خَيرًا لَهُم
21.translation_eng: Obedience and upright speech … .1So when the matter has been resolved upon,if they remain true to Allahthat will surely be better for them.Ellipsis; the omitted phrase is ‘are all that is expected of you.’
21.transliteration: ṭāʿatun wa-qawlun maʿrūfun fa-ʾidhā ʿazama l-ʾamru fa-law ṣadaqū llāha la-kāna khayran lahum

22.content: فَهَل عَسَيتُم إِن تَوَلَّيتُم أَن تُفسِدوا فِي الأَرضِ وَتُقَطِّعوا أَرحامَكُم
22.translation_eng: May it not be that if you were to wield authorityyou would cause corruption in the landand ill-treat your blood relations?
22.transliteration: fa-hal ʿasaytum ʾin tawallaytum ʾan tufsidū fī l-ʾarḍi wa-tuqaṭṭiʿū ʾarḥāmakum

23.content: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ لَعَنَهُمُ اللَّهُ فَأَصَمَّهُم وَأَعمىٰ أَبصارَهُم
23.translation_eng: They are the ones whom Allah has cursed,so He made them deaf, and blinded their sight.
23.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lladhīna laʿanahumu llāhu fa-ʾaṣammahum wa-ʾaʿmā ʾabṣārahum

24.content: أَفَلا يَتَدَبَّرونَ القُرآنَ أَم عَلىٰ قُلوبٍ أَقفالُها
24.translation_eng: Do they not contemplate the Qurʾān,or are there locks on the hearts?
24.transliteration: ʾa-fa-lā yatadabbarūna l-qurʾāna ʾam ʿalā qulūbin ʾaqfāluhā

25.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ ارتَدّوا عَلىٰ أَدبارِهِم مِن بَعدِ ما تَبَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الهُدَى ۙ الشَّيطانُ سَوَّلَ لَهُم وَأَملىٰ لَهُم
25.translation_eng: Indeed those who turned their backsafter the guidance had become clear to them,it was Satan who had seduced them,and he had given them [far-flung] hopes.1Or ‘and He [i.e. Allah] gave them respite.’
25.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna rtaddū ʿalā ʾadbārihim min baʿdi mā tabayyana lahumu l-hudā sh-shayṭānu sawwala lahum wa-ʾamlā lahum

26.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُم قالوا لِلَّذينَ كَرِهوا ما نَزَّلَ اللَّهُ سَنُطيعُكُم في بَعضِ الأَمرِ ۖ وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ إِسرارَهُم
26.translation_eng: That is because they saidto those who loathed what Allah had sent down:‘We shall obey you in some matters,’and Allah knows their secret dealings.
26.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾannahum qālū li-lladhīna karihū mā nazzala llāhu sa-nuṭīʿukum fī baʿḍi l-ʾamri wa-llāhu yaʿlamu ʾisrārahum

27.content: فَكَيفَ إِذا تَوَفَّتهُمُ المَلائِكَةُ يَضرِبونَ وُجوهَهُم وَأَدبارَهُم
27.translation_eng: But how will it be [with them]when the angels take them away,striking their faces and their backs?!
27.transliteration: fa-kayfa ʾidhā tawaffathumu l-malāʾikatu yaḍribūna wujūhahum wa-ʾadbārahum

28.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمُ اتَّبَعوا ما أَسخَطَ اللَّهَ وَكَرِهوا رِضوانَهُ فَأَحبَطَ أَعمالَهُم
28.translation_eng: That, because they pursued what displeased Allah,and loathed His pleasure.So He has made their works fail.
28.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾannahumu ttabaʿū mā ʾaskhaṭa llāha wa-karihū riḍwānahū fa-ʾaḥbaṭa ʾaʿmālahum

29.content: أَم حَسِبَ الَّذينَ في قُلوبِهِم مَرَضٌ أَن لَن يُخرِجَ اللَّهُ أَضغانَهُم
29.translation_eng: Do those in whose hearts is a sickness supposethat Allah will not expose their spite?
29.transliteration: ʾam ḥasiba lladhīna fī qulūbihim maraḍun ʾan lan yukhrija llāhu ʾaḍghānahum

30.content: وَلَو نَشاءُ لَأَرَيناكَهُم فَلَعَرَفتَهُم بِسيماهُم ۚ وَلَتَعرِفَنَّهُم في لَحنِ القَولِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ أَعمالَكُم
30.translation_eng: If We wish, We will show them1 to youso that you recognize them by their mark.Yet you will recognize them by their tone of speech,and Allah knows your deeds.That is, the hypocrites.
30.transliteration: wa-law nashāʾu la-ʾaraynākahum fa-la-ʿaraftahum bi-sīmāhum wa-la-taʿrifannahum fī laḥni l-qawli wa-llāhu yaʿlamu ʾaʿmālakum

31.content: وَلَنَبلُوَنَّكُم حَتّىٰ نَعلَمَ المُجاهِدينَ مِنكُم وَالصّابِرينَ وَنَبلُوَ أَخبارَكُم
31.translation_eng: We will surely test youuntil We ascertain those of you who wage jihādand those who are steadfast,and We shall appraise your record.
31.transliteration: wa-la-nabluwannakum ḥattā naʿlama l-mujāhidīna minkum wa-ṣ-ṣābirīna wa-nabluwa ʾakhbārakum

32.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَصَدّوا عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ وَشاقُّوا الرَّسولَ مِن بَعدِ ما تَبَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الهُدىٰ لَن يَضُرُّوا اللَّهَ شَيئًا وَسَيُحبِطُ أَعمالَهُم
32.translation_eng: Indeed those who are faithlessand bar from the way of Allahand defy the Apostleafter guidance has become clear to them,will not hurt Allah in the least,and He shall make their works fail.
32.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna kafarū wa-ṣaddū ʿan sabīli llāhi wa-shāqqū r-rasūla min baʿdi mā tabayyana lahumu l-hudā lan yaḍurrū llāha shayʾan wa-sa-yuḥbiṭu ʾaʿmālahum

33.content: ۞ يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا أَطيعُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطيعُوا الرَّسولَ وَلا تُبطِلوا أَعمالَكُم
33.translation_eng: O you who have faith!Obey Allah and obey the Apostle,and do not render your works void.
33.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾaṭīʿū llāha wa-ʾaṭīʿū r-rasūla wa-lā tubṭilū ʾaʿmālakum

34.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَصَدّوا عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ ثُمَّ ماتوا وَهُم كُفّارٌ فَلَن يَغفِرَ اللَّهُ لَهُم
34.translation_eng: Indeed those who are faithlessand bar from the way of Allahand then die faithless,Allah will never forgive them.
34.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna kafarū wa-ṣaddū ʿan sabīli llāhi thumma mātū wa-hum kuffārun fa-lan yaghfira llāhu lahum

35.content: فَلا تَهِنوا وَتَدعوا إِلَى السَّلمِ وَأَنتُمُ الأَعلَونَ وَاللَّهُ مَعَكُم وَلَن يَتِرَكُم أَعمالَكُم
35.translation_eng: So do not slacken and [do not] call for peacewhen you have the upper handand Allah is with you,and He will not stint [the reward of] your works.
35.transliteration: fa-lā tahinū wa-tadʿū ʾilā s-salmi wa-ʾantumu l-ʾaʿlawna wa-llāhu maʿakum wa-lan yatirakum ʾaʿmālakum

36.content: إِنَّمَا الحَياةُ الدُّنيا لَعِبٌ وَلَهوٌ ۚ وَإِن تُؤمِنوا وَتَتَّقوا يُؤتِكُم أُجورَكُم وَلا يَسأَلكُم أَموالَكُم
36.translation_eng: The life of the world is just play and diversion,but if you are faithful and Godwary,He will give you your rewards,and will not ask your wealth [in return] from you.
36.transliteration: ʾinnamā l-ḥayātu d-dunyā laʿibun wa-lahwun wa-ʾin tuʾminū wa-tattaqū yuʾtikum ʾujūrakum wa-lā yasʾalkum ʾamwālakum

37.content: إِن يَسأَلكُموها فَيُحفِكُم تَبخَلوا وَيُخرِج أَضغانَكُم
37.translation_eng: Should He ask it from you, and press you,you will be stingy, and He will expose your spite.
37.transliteration: ʾin yasʾalkumūhā fa-yuḥfikum tabkhalū wa-yukhrij ʾaḍghānakum

38.content: ها أَنتُم هٰؤُلاءِ تُدعَونَ لِتُنفِقوا في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ فَمِنكُم مَن يَبخَلُ ۖ وَمَن يَبخَل فَإِنَّما يَبخَلُ عَن نَفسِهِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ الغَنِيُّ وَأَنتُمُ الفُقَراءُ ۚ وَإِن تَتَوَلَّوا يَستَبدِل قَومًا غَيرَكُم ثُمَّ لا يَكونوا أَمثالَكُم
38.translation_eng: Ah! There you are,being invited to spend in the way of Allah;yet among you there are those who are stingy;and whoever is stingy is stingy only to himself.Allah is the All-sufficient, and you are all-needy,and if you turn awayHe will replace you with another people,and they will not be like you.
38.transliteration: hā-ʾantum hāʾulāʾi tudʿawna li-tunfiqū fī sabīli llāhi fa-minkum man yabkhalu wa-man yabkhal fa-ʾinnamā yabkhalu ʿan nafsihī wa-llāhu l-ghaniyyu wa-ʾantumu l-fuqarāʾu wa-ʾin tatawallaw yastabdil qawman ghayrakum thumma lā yakūnū ʾamthālakum

response.description: The surah that opens with the emphatic oath of the Divine One swearing by The City, that mankind us under the absolute power and watchfulness of God. It takes its name after the “city” or “town” (balad) mentioned in verse 1. The essential point of this surah is that man is created to work and be judged. He should therefore seek to do good deeds rather than indulge in arrogance and wastefulness.The surah is also known as: (This) Countryside, The Earth, The Land, The Town.

2.translation_eng: as you reside in this town;

3.translation_eng: by the father and him whom he begot:

4.translation_eng: certainly We created man in travail.

5.content: أَيَحسَبُ أَن لَن يَقدِرَ عَلَيهِ أَحَدٌ
5.translation_eng: Does he supposethat no one will ever have power over him?
5.transliteration: ʾa-yaḥsabu ʾan lan yaqdira ʿalayhi ʾaḥadun

6.translation_eng: He says, ‘I have squandered immense wealth.’

7.translation_eng: Does he suppose that no one sees him?

8.translation_eng: Have We not made for him two eyes,

10.translation_eng: and shown him the two paths [of good and evil]?

11.translation_eng: Yet he has not embarked upon the uphill task.

12.translation_eng: And what will show you what is the uphill task?

13.translation_eng: [It is] the freeing of a slave,

14.content: أَو إِطعامٌ في يَومٍ ذي مَسغَبَةٍ
14.translation_eng: or feeding [the needy] on a day of starvation,
14.transliteration: ʾaw ʾiṭʿāmun fī yawmin dhī masghabatin

16.translation_eng: or a needy man in desolation,

17.content: ثُمَّ كانَ مِنَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَتَواصَوا بِالصَّبرِ وَتَواصَوا بِالمَرحَمَةِ
17.translation_eng: while being one of those who have faithand who enjoin one another to patience,and enjoin one another to compassion.
17.transliteration: thumma kāna mina lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-tawāṣaw bi-ṣ-ṣabri wa-tawāṣaw bi-l-marḥamati

18.translation_eng: They are the People of the Right Hand.

19.content: وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا بِآياتِنا هُم أَصحابُ المَشأَمَةِ
19.translation_eng: But those who defy Our signs,they are the People of the Left Hand.
19.transliteration: wa-lladhīna kafarū bi-ʾāyātinā hum ʾaṣḥābu l-mashʾamati

20.translation_eng: [Imposed] upon them will be a closed Fire.

response.description: The surah that mentions an ancient prophet after Noah named Hūd, whom God sent to the mighty people of ʿĀd, the dwellers of a great pillared city called Iram. It is named after Hūd, whose account is given in verse 50 . The surah begins by announcing that the Prophet is sent both to warn and to give good news, and the body of the surah focuses on the warning aspect: God watches over everything and is aware of all that people do (verse 5 ., verse 111 . and verse 123). The many stories of past prophets, which serve to warn the disbelievers, also strengthen the heart of the Prophet (verse 120).The surah is also known as: Hood, Hud (The Messenger), The Prophet Hud.

1.content: الر ۚ كِتابٌ أُحكِمَت آياتُهُ ثُمَّ فُصِّلَت مِن لَدُن حَكيمٍ خَبيرٍ
1.translation_eng: Alif, Lām, Rā. [This is] a Book, whose signs have been made definitive1 and the elaborated2 from One [who is] all-wise, all-aware,Cf. 3:7.Or ‘articulated.’
1.transliteration: a-l-r (ʾalif lām rā) kitābun ʾuḥkimat ʾāyātuhū thumma fuṣṣilat min ladun ḥakīmin khabīrin

2.content: أَلّا تَعبُدوا إِلَّا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّني لَكُم مِنهُ نَذيرٌ وَبَشيرٌ
2.translation_eng: declaring: ‘Worship no one but Allah. I am indeed a warner from Him to you and a bearer of good news.
2.transliteration: ʾallā taʿbudū ʾillā llāha ʾinnanī lakum minhu nadhīrun wa-bashīrun

3.content: وَأَنِ استَغفِروا رَبَّكُم ثُمَّ توبوا إِلَيهِ يُمَتِّعكُم مَتاعًا حَسَنًا إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى وَيُؤتِ كُلَّ ذي فَضلٍ فَضلَهُ ۖ وَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَإِنّي أَخافُ عَلَيكُم عَذابَ يَومٍ كَبيرٍ
3.translation_eng: Plead with your Lord for forgiveness, then turn to Him penitently. He will provide you with a good provision for a specified term and grant His grace to every meritorious person. But if you turn your backs [on Him], indeed I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day.
3.transliteration: wa-ʾani staghfirū rabbakum thumma tūbū ʾilayhi yumattiʿkum matāʿan ḥasanan ʾilā ʾajalin musamman wa-yuʾti kulla dhī faḍlin faḍlahū wa-ʾin tawallaw fa-ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʿalaykum ʿadhāba yawmin kabīrin

4.content: إِلَى اللَّهِ مَرجِعُكُم ۖ وَهُوَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
4.translation_eng: To Allah will be your return, and He has power over all things.’
4.transliteration: ʾilā llāhi marjiʿukum wa-huwa ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun

5.content: أَلا إِنَّهُم يَثنونَ صُدورَهُم لِيَستَخفوا مِنهُ ۚ أَلا حينَ يَستَغشونَ ثِيابَهُم يَعلَمُ ما يُسِرّونَ وَما يُعلِنونَ ۚ إِنَّهُ عَليمٌ بِذاتِ الصُّدورِ
5.translation_eng: Look! They fold up their breasts1 to hide [their secret feelings] from Him. Look! When they draw their cloaks over their heads,2 He knows whatever they keep secret and whatever they disclose. Indeed He knows best whatever is in the breasts.‘To fold up one’s breast’ is an idiomatic phrase, meaning to conceal one’s spite within one’s heart.So that they may not be recognized. Cf. 71:7.
5.transliteration: ʾa-lā ʾinnahum yathnūna ṣudūrahum li-yastakhfū minhu ʾa-lā ḥīna yastaghshūna thiyābahum yaʿlamu mā yusirrūna wa-mā yuʿlinūna ʾinnahū ʿalīmun bi-dhāti ṣ-ṣudūri

6.content: ۞ وَما مِن دابَّةٍ فِي الأَرضِ إِلّا عَلَى اللَّهِ رِزقُها وَيَعلَمُ مُستَقَرَّها وَمُستَودَعَها ۚ كُلٌّ في كِتابٍ مُبينٍ
6.translation_eng: There is no animal on the earth, but that its sustenance lies with Allah, and He knows its [enduring] abode and its temporary place of lodging. Everything is in a manifest Book.
6.transliteration: wa-mā min dābbatin fī l-ʾarḍi ʾillā ʿalā llāhi rizquhā wa-yaʿlamu mustaqarrahā wa-mustawdaʿahā kullun fī kitābin mubīnin

7.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ في سِتَّةِ أَيّامٍ وَكانَ عَرشُهُ عَلَى الماءِ لِيَبلُوَكُم أَيُّكُم أَحسَنُ عَمَلًا ۗ وَلَئِن قُلتَ إِنَّكُم مَبعوثونَ مِن بَعدِ المَوتِ لَيَقولَنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا إِن هٰذا إِلّا سِحرٌ مُبينٌ
7.translation_eng: It is He who created the heavens and the earth in six days —and His Throne was [then] upon the waters— that He may test you [to see] which of you is best in conduct. Yet if you say, ‘You will indeed be raised up after death,’ the faithless will surely say, ‘This is nothing but plain magic.’
7.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa fī sittati ʾayyāmin wa-kāna ʿarshuhū ʿalā l-māʾi li-yabluwakum ʾayyukum ʾaḥsanu ʿamalan wa-la-ʾin qulta ʾinnakum mabʿūthūna min baʿdi l-mawti la-yaqūlanna lladhīna kafarū ʾin hādhā ʾillā siḥrun mubīnun

8.content: وَلَئِن أَخَّرنا عَنهُمُ العَذابَ إِلىٰ أُمَّةٍ مَعدودَةٍ لَيَقولُنَّ ما يَحبِسُهُ ۗ أَلا يَومَ يَأتيهِم لَيسَ مَصروفًا عَنهُم وَحاقَ بِهِم ما كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِئونَ
8.translation_eng: And if We defer their punishment until a certain time, they will surely say, ‘What holds it back?’ Look! On the day it overtakes them it shall not be turned away from them, and they will be besieged by what they used to deride.
8.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin ʾakhkharnā ʿanhumu l-ʿadhāba ʾilā ʾummatin maʿdūdatin la-yaqūlunna mā yaḥbisuhū ʾa-lā yawma yaʾtīhim laysa maṣrūfan ʿanhum wa-ḥāqa bihim mā kānū bihī yastahziʾūna

9.content: وَلَئِن أَذَقنَا الإِنسانَ مِنّا رَحمَةً ثُمَّ نَزَعناها مِنهُ إِنَّهُ لَيَئوسٌ كَفورٌ
9.translation_eng: If We let man taste a mercy from Us, and then withdraw it from him, he becomes despondent, ungrateful.
9.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin ʾadhaqnā l-ʾinsāna minnā raḥmatan thumma nazaʿnāhā minhu ʾinnahū la-yaʾūsun kafūrun

10.content: وَلَئِن أَذَقناهُ نَعماءَ بَعدَ ضَرّاءَ مَسَّتهُ لَيَقولَنَّ ذَهَبَ السَّيِّئَاتُ عَنّي ۚ إِنَّهُ لَفَرِحٌ فَخورٌ
10.translation_eng: And if We let him have a taste of Our blessings after adversities have befallen him, he will surely say, ‘All ills have left me.’ Indeed he becomes an exultant braggart,
10.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin ʾadhaqnāhu naʿmāʾa baʿda ḍarrāʾa massathu la-yaqūlanna dhahaba s-sayyiʾātu ʿannī ʾinnahū la-fariḥun fakhūrun

11.content: إِلَّا الَّذينَ صَبَروا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ أُولٰئِكَ لَهُم مَغفِرَةٌ وَأَجرٌ كَبيرٌ
11.translation_eng: excepting those who are patient and do righteous deeds. For such there will be forgiveness and a great reward.
11.transliteration: ʾillā lladhīna ṣabarū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti ʾulāʾika lahum maghfiratun wa-ʾajrun kabīrun

12.content: فَلَعَلَّكَ تارِكٌ بَعضَ ما يوحىٰ إِلَيكَ وَضائِقٌ بِهِ صَدرُكَ أَن يَقولوا لَولا أُنزِلَ عَلَيهِ كَنزٌ أَو جاءَ مَعَهُ مَلَكٌ ۚ إِنَّما أَنتَ نَذيرٌ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ وَكيلٌ
12.translation_eng: [Look out] lest you should disregard aught of what has been revealed to you, and be upset because they say, ‘Why has not a treasure been sent down to him, or [why does] not an angel accompany him?’ You are only a warner, and Allah watches over all things.
12.transliteration: fa-laʿallaka tārikun baʿḍa mā yūḥā ʾilayka wa-ḍāʾiqun bihī ṣadruka ʾan yaqūlū law-lā ʾunzila ʿalayhi kanzun ʾaw jāʾa maʿahū malakun ʾinnamā ʾanta nadhīrun wa-llāhu ʿalā kulli shayʾin wakīlun

13.content: أَم يَقولونَ افتَراهُ ۖ قُل فَأتوا بِعَشرِ سُوَرٍ مِثلِهِ مُفتَرَياتٍ وَادعوا مَنِ استَطَعتُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
13.translation_eng: Do they say, ‘He has fabricated it?’ Say, ‘Then bring ten sūrahs like it, fabricated, and invoke whomever you can, besides Allah, should you be truthful.’
13.transliteration: ʾam yaqūlūna ftarāhu qul fa-ʾtū bi-ʿashri suwarin mithlihī muftarayātin wa-dʿū mani staṭaʿtum min dūni llāhi ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

14.content: فَإِلَّم يَستَجيبوا لَكُم فَاعلَموا أَنَّما أُنزِلَ بِعِلمِ اللَّهِ وَأَن لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ ۖ فَهَل أَنتُم مُسلِمونَ
14.translation_eng: But if they do not respond to you, know that it has been sent down by Allah’s knowledge, and that there is no god except Him. Will you, then, submit [to Allah]?
14.transliteration: fa-ʾillam yastajībū lakum fa-ʿlamū ʾannamā ʾunzila bi-ʿilmi llāhi wa-ʾan lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa fa-hal ʾantum muslimūna

15.content: مَن كانَ يُريدُ الحَياةَ الدُّنيا وَزينَتَها نُوَفِّ إِلَيهِم أَعمالَهُم فيها وَهُم فيها لا يُبخَسونَ
15.translation_eng: As for those who desire the life of this world and its glitter, We will recompense them fully for their works therein, and they shall not be underpaid in it.
15.transliteration: man kāna yurīdu l-ḥayāta d-dunyā wa-zīnatahā nuwaffi ʾilayhim ʾaʿmālahum fīhā wa-hum fīhā lā yubkhasūna

16.content: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ لَيسَ لَهُم فِي الآخِرَةِ إِلَّا النّارُ ۖ وَحَبِطَ ما صَنَعوا فيها وَباطِلٌ ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
16.translation_eng: They are the ones for whom there shall be nothing in the Hereafter but Fire: what they had accomplished in the world has failed, and their works have come to naught.
16.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lladhīna laysa lahum fī l-ʾākhirati ʾillā n-nāru wa-ḥabiṭa mā ṣanaʿū fīhā wa-bāṭilun mā kānū yaʿmalūna

17.content: أَفَمَن كانَ عَلىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِن رَبِّهِ وَيَتلوهُ شاهِدٌ مِنهُ وَمِن قَبلِهِ كِتابُ موسىٰ إِمامًا وَرَحمَةً ۚ أُولٰئِكَ يُؤمِنونَ بِهِ ۚ وَمَن يَكفُر بِهِ مِنَ الأَحزابِ فَالنّارُ مَوعِدُهُ ۚ فَلا تَكُ في مِريَةٍ مِنهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكَ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يُؤمِنونَ
17.translation_eng: Is he who stands on a manifest proof from his Lord, and whom a witness of his own [family] follows?1 And before him2 there was the Book of Moses, a guide and mercy. It is they who have faith in it, and whoever defies him from among the factions, the Fire is their tryst. So do not be in doubt about it; it is the truth from your Lord, but most people do not have faith.Ellipsis. That is, is such a person like someone who is not such? Or, can such a one be deterred by the denial of the ignorant?Or ‘before it,’ that is, the Qurʾān.
17.transliteration: ʾa-fa-man kāna ʿalā bayyinatin min rabbihī wa-yatlūhu shāhidun minhu wa-min qablihī kitābu mūsā ʾimāman wa-raḥmatan ʾulāʾika yuʾminūna bihī wa-man yakfur bihī mina l-ʾaḥzābi fa-n-nāru mawʿiduhū fa-lā taku fī miryatin minhu ʾinnahu l-ḥaqqu min rabbika wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yuʾminūna

18.content: وَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّنِ افتَرىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا ۚ أُولٰئِكَ يُعرَضونَ عَلىٰ رَبِّهِم وَيَقولُ الأَشهادُ هٰؤُلاءِ الَّذينَ كَذَبوا عَلىٰ رَبِّهِم ۚ أَلا لَعنَةُ اللَّهِ عَلَى الظّالِمينَ
18.translation_eng: And who is a greater wrongdoer than him who fabricates a lie against Allah? They shall be presented before their Lord, and the witnesses will say, ‘It is these who lied against their Lord.’ Look! The curse of Allah is upon the wrongdoers
18.transliteration: wa-man ʾaẓlamu mimmani ftarā ʿalā llāhi kadhiban ʾulāʾika yuʿraḍūna ʿalā rabbihim wa-yaqūlu l-ʾashhādu hāʾulāʾi lladhīna kadhabū ʿalā rabbihim ʾa-lā laʿnatu llāhi ʿalā ẓ-ẓālimīna

19.content: الَّذينَ يَصُدّونَ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ وَيَبغونَها عِوَجًا وَهُم بِالآخِرَةِ هُم كافِرونَ
19.translation_eng: —those who bar [others] from the way of Allah, and seek to make it crooked, and disbelieve in the Hereafter.
19.transliteration: alladhīna yaṣuddūna ʿan sabīli llāhi wa-yabghūnahā ʿiwajan wa-hum bi-l-ʾākhirati hum kāfirūna

20.content: أُولٰئِكَ لَم يَكونوا مُعجِزينَ فِي الأَرضِ وَما كانَ لَهُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ مِن أَولِياءَ ۘ يُضاعَفُ لَهُمُ العَذابُ ۚ ما كانوا يَستَطيعونَ السَّمعَ وَما كانوا يُبصِرونَ
20.translation_eng: They cannot thwart [Allah] on the earth, nor do they have besides Allah any guardian. For them the punishment shall be doubled, for they could neither listen, nor did they use to see.
20.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lam yakūnū muʿjizīna fī l-ʾarḍi wa-mā kāna lahum min dūni llāhi min ʾawliyāʾa yuḍāʿafu lahumu l-ʿadhābu mā kānū yastaṭīʿūna s-samʿa wa-mā kānū yubṣirūna

21.content: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ خَسِروا أَنفُسَهُم وَضَلَّ عَنهُم ما كانوا يَفتَرونَ
21.translation_eng: They are the ones who have ruined their souls, and what they used to fabricate has forsaken them.
21.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lladhīna khasirū ʾanfusahum wa-ḍalla ʿanhum mā kānū yaftarūna

22.content: لا جَرَمَ أَنَّهُم فِي الآخِرَةِ هُمُ الأَخسَرونَ
22.translation_eng: Undoubtedly, they are the ones who will be the biggest losers in the Hereafter.
22.transliteration: lā jarama ʾannahum fī l-ʾākhirati humu l-ʾakhsarūna

23.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ وَأَخبَتوا إِلىٰ رَبِّهِم أُولٰئِكَ أَصحابُ الجَنَّةِ ۖ هُم فيها خالِدونَ
23.translation_eng: Indeed those who have faith and do righteous deeds and are humble before their Lord —they shall be the inhabitants of paradise, and they shall remain in it [forever].
23.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti wa-ʾakhbatū ʾilā rabbihim ʾulāʾika ʾaṣḥābu l-jannati hum fīhā khālidūna

24.content: ۞ مَثَلُ الفَريقَينِ كَالأَعمىٰ وَالأَصَمِّ وَالبَصيرِ وَالسَّميعِ ۚ هَل يَستَوِيانِ مَثَلًا ۚ أَفَلا تَذَكَّرونَ
24.translation_eng: The parable of the two parties is that of one who is blind and deaf and one who sees and hears. Are they equal in comparison? Will you not then take admonition?
24.transliteration: mathalu l-farīqayni ka-l-ʾaʿmā wa-l-ʾaṣammi wa-l-baṣīri wa-s-samīʿi hal yastawiyāni mathalan ʾa-fa-lā tadhakkarūna

25.content: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا نوحًا إِلىٰ قَومِهِ إِنّي لَكُم نَذيرٌ مُبينٌ
25.translation_eng: Certainly We sent Noah to his people [to declare]: ‘Indeed I am a manifest warner to you,
25.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾarsalnā nūḥan ʾilā qawmihī ʾinnī lakum nadhīrun mubīnun

26.content: أَن لا تَعبُدوا إِلَّا اللَّهَ ۖ إِنّي أَخافُ عَلَيكُم عَذابَ يَومٍ أَليمٍ
26.translation_eng: Worship none but Allah. Indeed I fear for you the punishment of a painful day.’
26.transliteration: ʾan lā taʿbudū ʾillā llāha ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʿalaykum ʿadhāba yawmin ʾalīmin

27.content: فَقالَ المَلَأُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن قَومِهِ ما نَراكَ إِلّا بَشَرًا مِثلَنا وَما نَراكَ اتَّبَعَكَ إِلَّا الَّذينَ هُم أَراذِلُنا بادِيَ الرَّأيِ وَما نَرىٰ لَكُم عَلَينا مِن فَضلٍ بَل نَظُنُّكُم كاذِبينَ
27.translation_eng: But the elite of the faithless from among his people said, ‘We do not see you to be anything but a human being like ourselves, and we do not see anyone following you except those who are simpleminded riffraff from our midst. Nor do we see that you have any merit over us. Rather we consider you to be liars.’
27.transliteration: fa-qāla l-malaʾu lladhīna kafarū min qawmihī mā narāka ʾillā basharan mithlanā wa-mā narāka ttabaʿaka ʾillā lladhīna hum ʾarādhilunā bādiya r-raʾyi wa-mā narā lakum ʿalaynā min faḍlin bal naẓunnukum kādhibīna

28.content: قالَ يا قَومِ أَرَأَيتُم إِن كُنتُ عَلىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِن رَبّي وَآتاني رَحمَةً مِن عِندِهِ فَعُمِّيَت عَلَيكُم أَنُلزِمُكُموها وَأَنتُم لَها كارِهونَ
28.translation_eng: He said, ‘O my people! Tell me, should I stand on a manifest proof from my Lord, and He has granted me His own mercy —though it should be invisible to you— shall we force it upon you while you are averse to it?
28.transliteration: qāla yā-qawmi ʾa-raʾaytum ʾin kuntu ʿalā bayyinatin min rabbī wa-ʾātānī raḥmatan min ʿindihī fa-ʿummiyat ʿalaykum ʾa-nulzimukumūhā wa-ʾantum lahā kārihūna

29.content: وَيا قَومِ لا أَسأَلُكُم عَلَيهِ مالًا ۖ إِن أَجرِيَ إِلّا عَلَى اللَّهِ ۚ وَما أَنا بِطارِدِ الَّذينَ آمَنوا ۚ إِنَّهُم مُلاقو رَبِّهِم وَلٰكِنّي أَراكُم قَومًا تَجهَلونَ
29.translation_eng: O my people! I do not ask you any material reward for it. My reward lies only with Allah. But I will not drive away those who have faith. Indeed they will encounter their Lord. But I see that you are an ignorant lot.
29.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi lā ʾasʾalukum ʿalayhi mālan ʾin ʾajriya ʾillā ʿalā llāhi wa-mā ʾana bi-ṭāridi lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾinnahum mulāqū rabbihim wa-lākinnī ʾarākum qawman tajhalūna

30.content: وَيا قَومِ مَن يَنصُرُني مِنَ اللَّهِ إِن طَرَدتُهُم ۚ أَفَلا تَذَكَّرونَ
30.translation_eng: O my people! Who would come to my help against Allah were I to drive them away? Will you not then take admonition?
30.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi man yanṣurunī mina llāhi ʾin ṭaradtuhum ʾa-fa-lā tadhakkarūna

31.content: وَلا أَقولُ لَكُم عِندي خَزائِنُ اللَّهِ وَلا أَعلَمُ الغَيبَ وَلا أَقولُ إِنّي مَلَكٌ وَلا أَقولُ لِلَّذينَ تَزدَري أَعيُنُكُم لَن يُؤتِيَهُمُ اللَّهُ خَيرًا ۖ اللَّهُ أَعلَمُ بِما في أَنفُسِهِم ۖ إِنّي إِذًا لَمِنَ الظّالِمينَ
31.translation_eng: I do not say to you that I possess the treasuries of Allah, neither do I know the Unseen. I do not claim to be an angel, neither do I say of those who are despicable in your eyes that Allah will not grant them any good —Allah knows best what is in their hearts— for then I would indeed be a wrongdoer.’
31.transliteration: wa-lā ʾaqūlu lakum ʿindī khazāʾinu llāhi wa-lā ʾaʿlamu l-ghayba wa-lā ʾaqūlu ʾinnī malakun wa-lā ʾaqūlu li-lladhīna tazdarī ʾaʿyunukum lan yuʾtiyahumu llāhu khayran-i llāhu ʾaʿlamu bi-mā fī ʾanfusihim ʾinnī ʾidhan la-mina ẓ-ẓālimīna

32.content: قالوا يا نوحُ قَد جادَلتَنا فَأَكثَرتَ جِدالَنا فَأتِنا بِما تَعِدُنا إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصّادِقينَ
32.translation_eng: They said, ‘O Noah, you have disputed with us already, and you have disputed with us exceedingly. Now bring us what you threaten us with should you be truthful.
32.transliteration: qālū yā-nūḥu qad jādaltanā fa-ʾaktharta jidālanā fa-ʾtinā bi-mā taʿidunā ʾin kunta mina ṣ-ṣādiqīna

33.content: قالَ إِنَّما يَأتيكُم بِهِ اللَّهُ إِن شاءَ وَما أَنتُم بِمُعجِزينَ
33.translation_eng: He said, ‘Allah will indeed bring it on you if He wishes, and you cannot thwart [Him].
33.transliteration: qāla ʾinnamā yaʾtīkum bihi llāhu ʾin shāʾa wa-mā ʾantum bi-muʿjizīna

34.content: وَلا يَنفَعُكُم نُصحي إِن أَرَدتُ أَن أَنصَحَ لَكُم إِن كانَ اللَّهُ يُريدُ أَن يُغوِيَكُم ۚ هُوَ رَبُّكُم وَإِلَيهِ تُرجَعونَ
34.translation_eng: My exhorting will not benefit you, much as I may seek to exhort you, if Allah desires to consign you to perversity. He is your Lord, and to Him you shall be brought back.’
34.transliteration: wa-lā yanfaʿukum nuṣḥī ʾin ʾaradtu ʾan ʾanṣaḥa lakum ʾin kāna llāhu yurīdu ʾan yughwiyakum huwa rabbukum wa-ʾilayhi turjaʿūna

35.content: أَم يَقولونَ افتَراهُ ۖ قُل إِنِ افتَرَيتُهُ فَعَلَيَّ إِجرامي وَأَنا بَريءٌ مِمّا تُجرِمونَ
35.translation_eng: Do they say, ‘He has fabricated it?’ Say, ‘Should I have fabricated it, then my guilt will be upon me, and I am absolved of your guilty conduct.’
35.transliteration: ʾam yaqūlūna ftarāhu qul ʾini ftaraytuhū fa-ʿalayya ʾijrāmī wa-ʾana barīʾun mimmā tujrimūna

36.content: وَأوحِيَ إِلىٰ نوحٍ أَنَّهُ لَن يُؤمِنَ مِن قَومِكَ إِلّا مَن قَد آمَنَ فَلا تَبتَئِس بِما كانوا يَفعَلونَ
36.translation_eng: It was revealed to Noah: ‘None of your people will believe except those who already have faith; so do not sorrow for what they used to do.
36.transliteration: wa-ʾūḥiya ʾilā nūḥin ʾannahū lan yuʾmina min qawmika ʾillā man qad ʾāmana fa-lā tabtaʾis bi-mā kānū yafʿalūna

37.content: وَاصنَعِ الفُلكَ بِأَعيُنِنا وَوَحيِنا وَلا تُخاطِبني فِي الَّذينَ ظَلَموا ۚ إِنَّهُم مُغرَقونَ
37.translation_eng: Build the ark before Our eyes and by Our revelation, and do not plead with Me for those who are wrongdoers: they shall indeed be drowned.’
37.transliteration: wa-ṣnaʿi l-fulka bi-ʾaʿyuninā wa-waḥyinā wa-lā tukhāṭibnī fī lladhīna ẓalamū ʾinnahum mughraqūna

38.content: وَيَصنَعُ الفُلكَ وَكُلَّما مَرَّ عَلَيهِ مَلَأٌ مِن قَومِهِ سَخِروا مِنهُ ۚ قالَ إِن تَسخَروا مِنّا فَإِنّا نَسخَرُ مِنكُم كَما تَسخَرونَ
38.translation_eng: As he was building the ark, whenever the elders of his people passed by him, they would ridicule him. He said, ‘If you ridicule us [today], we shall ridicule you [tomorrow] just as you ridicule us [now].
38.transliteration: wa-yaṣnaʿu l-fulka wa-kullamā marra ʿalayhi malaʾun min qawmihī sakhirū minhu qāla ʾin taskharū minnā fa-ʾinnā naskharu minkum ka-mā taskharūna

39.content: فَسَوفَ تَعلَمونَ مَن يَأتيهِ عَذابٌ يُخزيهِ وَيَحِلُّ عَلَيهِ عَذابٌ مُقيمٌ
39.translation_eng: Soon you will know whom a disgraceful punishment will overtake and on whom a lasting punishment will descend.’
39.transliteration: fa-sawfa taʿlamūna man yaʾtīhi ʿadhābun yukhzīhi wa-yaḥillu ʿalayhi ʿadhābun muqīmun

40.content: حَتّىٰ إِذا جاءَ أَمرُنا وَفارَ التَّنّورُ قُلنَا احمِل فيها مِن كُلٍّ زَوجَينِ اثنَينِ وَأَهلَكَ إِلّا مَن سَبَقَ عَلَيهِ القَولُ وَمَن آمَنَ ۚ وَما آمَنَ مَعَهُ إِلّا قَليلٌ
40.translation_eng: When Our edict came and the oven gushed [a stream of water], We said, ‘Carry in it a pair1 of every kind [of animal], along with your family —except those [of them] against whom the edict has already been given— and those who have faith.’ And none believed with him except a few.That is, male and female. Cf. 23:27.
40.transliteration: ḥattā ʾidhā jāʾa ʾamrunā wa-fāra t-tannūru qulnā ḥmil fīhā min kullin zawjayni thnayni wa-ʾahlaka ʾillā man sabaqa ʿalayhi l-qawlu wa-man ʾāmana wa-mā ʾāmana maʿahū ʾillā qalīlun

41.content: ۞ وَقالَ اركَبوا فيها بِسمِ اللَّهِ مَجراها وَمُرساها ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي لَغَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
41.translation_eng: He said, ‘Board it: In the Name of Allah it shall set sail and cast anchor. Indeed my Lord is all-forgiving, all-merciful.’
41.transliteration: wa-qāla rkabū fīhā bi-smi llāhi majrāhā wa-mursāhā ʾinna rabbī la-ghafūrun raḥīmun

42.content: وَهِيَ تَجري بِهِم في مَوجٍ كَالجِبالِ وَنادىٰ نوحٌ ابنَهُ وَكانَ في مَعزِلٍ يا بُنَيَّ اركَب مَعَنا وَلا تَكُن مَعَ الكافِرينَ
42.translation_eng: And it sailed along with them amid waves [rising] like mountains. Noah called out to his son, who stood aloof, ‘O my son! ‘Board with us, and do not be with the faithless!’
42.transliteration: wa-hiya tajrī bihim fī mawjin ka-l-jibāli wa-nādā nūḥun-i bnahū wa-kāna fī maʿzilin yā-bunayya rkab maʿanā wa-lā takun maʿa l-kāfirīna

43.content: قالَ سَآوي إِلىٰ جَبَلٍ يَعصِمُني مِنَ الماءِ ۚ قالَ لا عاصِمَ اليَومَ مِن أَمرِ اللَّهِ إِلّا مَن رَحِمَ ۚ وَحالَ بَينَهُمَا المَوجُ فَكانَ مِنَ المُغرَقينَ
43.translation_eng: He said, ‘I shall take refuge on a mountain; it will protect me from the flood.’ He said, ‘There is none today who can protect from Allah’s edict, except someone upon whom He has mercy.’ Then the waves came between them, and he was among those who were drowned.
43.transliteration: qāla sa-ʾāwī ʾilā jabalin yaʿṣimunī mina l-māʾi qāla lā ʿāṣima l-yawma min ʾamri llāhi ʾillā man raḥima wa-ḥāla baynahumā l-mawju fa-kāna mina l-mughraqīna

44.content: وَقيلَ يا أَرضُ ابلَعي ماءَكِ وَيا سَماءُ أَقلِعي وَغيضَ الماءُ وَقُضِيَ الأَمرُ وَاستَوَت عَلَى الجودِيِّ ۖ وَقيلَ بُعدًا لِلقَومِ الظّالِمينَ
44.translation_eng: Then it was said, ‘O earth, swallow your water! O sky, leave off!’ The waters receded; the edict was carried out, and it1 settled on [Mount] Judi. Then it was said, ‘Away with the wrongdoing lot!’That is, the Ark of Noah.
44.transliteration: wa-qīla yā-ʾarḍu blaʿī māʾaki wa-yā-samāʾu ʾaqliʿī wa-ghīḍa l-māʾu wa-quḍiya l-ʾamru wa-stawat ʿalā l-jūdiyyi wa-qīla buʿdan li-l-qawmi ẓ-ẓālimīna

45.content: وَنادىٰ نوحٌ رَبَّهُ فَقالَ رَبِّ إِنَّ ابني مِن أَهلي وَإِنَّ وَعدَكَ الحَقُّ وَأَنتَ أَحكَمُ الحاكِمينَ
45.translation_eng: Noah called out to his Lord, and said, ‘My Lord! My son is indeed from my family. Your promise is indeed true, and You are the fairest of all judges.’
45.transliteration: wa-nādā nūḥun rabbahū fa-qāla rabbi ʾinna bnī min ʾahlī wa-ʾinna waʿdaka l-ḥaqqu wa-ʾanta ʾaḥkamu l-ḥākimīna

46.content: قالَ يا نوحُ إِنَّهُ لَيسَ مِن أَهلِكَ ۖ إِنَّهُ عَمَلٌ غَيرُ صالِحٍ ۖ فَلا تَسأَلنِ ما لَيسَ لَكَ بِهِ عِلمٌ ۖ إِنّي أَعِظُكَ أَن تَكونَ مِنَ الجاهِلينَ
46.translation_eng: Said He, ‘O Noah! Indeed He is not of your family. Indeed he is [personification of] unrighteous conduct. So do not ask Me [something] of which you have no knowledge. I advise you lest you should be among the ignorant.’
46.transliteration: qāla yā-nūḥu ʾinnahū laysa min ʾahlika ʾinnahū ʿamalun ghayru ṣāliḥin fa-lā tasʾalni mā laysa laka bihī ʿilmun ʾinnī ʾaʿiẓuka ʾan takūna mina l-jāhilīna

47.content: قالَ رَبِّ إِنّي أَعوذُ بِكَ أَن أَسأَلَكَ ما لَيسَ لي بِهِ عِلمٌ ۖ وَإِلّا تَغفِر لي وَتَرحَمني أَكُن مِنَ الخاسِرينَ
47.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord! I seek Your protection lest I should ask You something of which I have no knowledge. If You do not forgive me and have mercy upon me I shall be among the losers.’
47.transliteration: qāla rabbi ʾinnī ʾaʿūdhu bika ʾan ʾasʾalaka mā laysa lī bihī ʿilmun wa-ʾillā taghfir lī wa-tarḥamnī ʾakun mina l-khāsirīna

48.content: قيلَ يا نوحُ اهبِط بِسَلامٍ مِنّا وَبَرَكاتٍ عَلَيكَ وَعَلىٰ أُمَمٍ مِمَّن مَعَكَ ۚ وَأُمَمٌ سَنُمَتِّعُهُم ثُمَّ يَمَسُّهُم مِنّا عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
48.translation_eng: It was said, ‘O Noah! Disembark in peace from Us and with [Our] blessings upon you and upon nations [to descend] from those who are with you, and nations whom We shall provide for, then a painful punishment from Us shall befall them.’
48.transliteration: qīla yā-nūḥu hbiṭ bi-salāmin minnā wa-barakātin ʿalayka wa-ʿalā ʾumamin mimman maʿaka wa-ʾumamun sa-numattiʿuhum thumma yamassuhum minnā ʿadhābun ʾalīmun

49.content: تِلكَ مِن أَنباءِ الغَيبِ نوحيها إِلَيكَ ۖ ما كُنتَ تَعلَمُها أَنتَ وَلا قَومُكَ مِن قَبلِ هٰذا ۖ فَاصبِر ۖ إِنَّ العاقِبَةَ لِلمُتَّقينَ
49.translation_eng: These are accounts of the Unseen which We reveal to you. Neither you nor your people used to know them before this. So be patient. Indeed the outcome will be in favour of the Godwary.
49.transliteration: tilka min ʾanbāʾi l-ghaybi nūḥīhā ʾilayka mā kunta taʿlamuhā ʾanta wa-lā qawmuka min qabli hādhā fa-ṣbir ʾinna l-ʿāqibata li-l-muttaqīna

50.content: وَإِلىٰ عادٍ أَخاهُم هودًا ۚ قالَ يا قَومِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلٰهٍ غَيرُهُ ۖ إِن أَنتُم إِلّا مُفتَرونَ
50.translation_eng: And to ʿĀd [We sent] Hūd, their brother. He said, ‘O my people! Worship Allah. You have no other god besides Him: you merely fabricate [the deities that you worship].
50.transliteration: wa-ʾilā ʿādin ʾakhāhum hūdan qāla yā-qawmi ʿbudū llāha mā lakum min ʾilāhin ghayruhū ʾin ʾantum ʾillā muftarūna

51.content: يا قَومِ لا أَسأَلُكُم عَلَيهِ أَجرًا ۖ إِن أَجرِيَ إِلّا عَلَى الَّذي فَطَرَني ۚ أَفَلا تَعقِلونَ
51.translation_eng: ‘O my people! I do not ask you any reward for it. My reward lies only with Him who originated me. Do you not apply reason?
51.transliteration: yā-qawmi lā ʾasʾalukum ʿalayhi ʾajran ʾin ʾajriya ʾillā ʿalā lladhī faṭaranī ʾa-fa-lā taʿqilūna

52.content: وَيا قَومِ استَغفِروا رَبَّكُم ثُمَّ توبوا إِلَيهِ يُرسِلِ السَّماءَ عَلَيكُم مِدرارًا وَيَزِدكُم قُوَّةً إِلىٰ قُوَّتِكُم وَلا تَتَوَلَّوا مُجرِمينَ
52.translation_eng: ‘O my people! Plead with your Lord for forgiveness, then turn to Him penitently: He will send copious rains for you from the sky, and add power to your [present] power. So do not turn your backs [on Him] as guilty ones.’
52.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi staghfirū rabbakum thumma tūbū ʾilayhi yursili s-samāʾa ʿalaykum midrāran wa-yazidkum quwwatan ʾilā quwwatikum wa-lā tatawallaw mujrimīna

53.content: قالوا يا هودُ ما جِئتَنا بِبَيِّنَةٍ وَما نَحنُ بِتارِكي آلِهَتِنا عَن قَولِكَ وَما نَحنُ لَكَ بِمُؤمِنينَ
53.translation_eng: They said, ‘O Hūd, you have not brought us any manifest proof. We are not going to abandon our gods for what you say, and we are not going to believe you.
53.transliteration: qālū yā-hūdu mā jiʾtanā bi-bayyinatin wa-mā naḥnu bi-tārikī ʾālihatinā ʿan qawlika wa-mā naḥnu laka bi-muʾminīna

54.content: إِن نَقولُ إِلَّا اعتَراكَ بَعضُ آلِهَتِنا بِسوءٍ ۗ قالَ إِنّي أُشهِدُ اللَّهَ وَاشهَدوا أَنّي بَريءٌ مِمّا تُشرِكونَ
54.translation_eng: All we say is that some of our gods have visited you with some evil.’ He said, ‘I call Allah to witness —and you too be [my] witnesses— that I repudiate what you take as [His] partners
54.transliteration: ʾin naqūlu ʾillā ʿtarāka baʿḍu ʾālihatinā bi-sūʾin qāla ʾinnī ʾushhidu llāha wa-shhadū ʾannī barīʾun mimmā tushrikūna

55.content: مِن دونِهِ ۖ فَكيدوني جَميعًا ثُمَّ لا تُنظِرونِ
55.translation_eng: besides Him. Now try out your stratagems against me, together, without granting me any respite.
55.transliteration: min dūnihī fa-kīdūnī jamīʿan thumma lā tunẓirūni

56.content: إِنّي تَوَكَّلتُ عَلَى اللَّهِ رَبّي وَرَبِّكُم ۚ ما مِن دابَّةٍ إِلّا هُوَ آخِذٌ بِناصِيَتِها ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي عَلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
56.translation_eng: Indeed I have put my trust in Allah, my Lord and your Lord. There is no living being but He holds it by its forelock. Indeed my Lord is on a straight path.
56.transliteration: ʾinnī tawakkaltu ʿalā llāhi rabbī wa-rabbikum mā min dābbatin ʾillā huwa ʾākhidhun bi-nāṣiyatihā ʾinna rabbī ʿalā ṣirāṭin mustaqīmin

57.content: فَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَقَد أَبلَغتُكُم ما أُرسِلتُ بِهِ إِلَيكُم ۚ وَيَستَخلِفُ رَبّي قَومًا غَيرَكُم وَلا تَضُرّونَهُ شَيئًا ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ حَفيظٌ
57.translation_eng: But if you turn your backs [on me], then [know that] I have communicated to you whatever I was sent to you with. My Lord will make another people succeed you, and you will not hurt Allah in the least. Indeed my Lord is watchful over all things.’
57.transliteration: fa-ʾin tawallaw fa-qad ʾablaghtukum mā ʾursiltu bihī ʾilaykum wa-yastakhlifu rabbī qawman ghayrakum wa-lā taḍurrūnahū shayʾan ʾinna rabbī ʿalā kulli shayʾin ḥafīẓun

58.content: وَلَمّا جاءَ أَمرُنا نَجَّينا هودًا وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا مَعَهُ بِرَحمَةٍ مِنّا وَنَجَّيناهُم مِن عَذابٍ غَليظٍ
58.translation_eng: And when Our edict came, We delivered Hūd and the faithful who were with him, by a mercy from Us, and We delivered them from a harsh punishment.
58.transliteration: wa-lammā jāʾa ʾamrunā najjaynā hūdan wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū maʿahū bi-raḥmatin minnā wa-najjaynāhum min ʿadhābin ghalīẓin

59.content: وَتِلكَ عادٌ ۖ جَحَدوا بِآياتِ رَبِّهِم وَعَصَوا رُسُلَهُ وَاتَّبَعوا أَمرَ كُلِّ جَبّارٍ عَنيدٍ
59.translation_eng: Such were [the people of] ʿĀd: they impugned the signs of their Lord and disobeyed His apostles, and followed the dictates of every obdurate tyrant.
59.transliteration: wa-tilka ʿādun jaḥadū bi-ʾāyāti rabbihim wa-ʿaṣaw rusulahū wa-ttabaʿū ʾamra kulli jabbārin ʿanīdin

60.content: وَأُتبِعوا في هٰذِهِ الدُّنيا لَعنَةً وَيَومَ القِيامَةِ ۗ أَلا إِنَّ عادًا كَفَروا رَبَّهُم ۗ أَلا بُعدًا لِعادٍ قَومِ هودٍ
60.translation_eng: So they were pursued by a curse in this world and on the Day of Resurrection. Look! Indeed ʿĀd defied their Lord. Look! Away with ʿĀd, the people of Hud!
60.transliteration: wa-ʾutbiʿū fī hādhihi d-dunyā laʿnatan wa-yawma l-qiyāmati ʾa-lā ʾinna ʿādan kafarū rabbahum ʾa-lā buʿdan li-ʾādin qawmi hūdin

61.content: ۞ وَإِلىٰ ثَمودَ أَخاهُم صالِحًا ۚ قالَ يا قَومِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلٰهٍ غَيرُهُ ۖ هُوَ أَنشَأَكُم مِنَ الأَرضِ وَاستَعمَرَكُم فيها فَاستَغفِروهُ ثُمَّ توبوا إِلَيهِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي قَريبٌ مُجيبٌ
61.translation_eng: And to Thamūd [We sent] Ṣāliḥ, their brother. He said, ‘O my people! Worship Allah. You have no other god besides Him. He brought you forth from the earth and made it your habitation. So plead with Him for forgiveness, then turn to Him penitently. My Lord is indeed nearmost [and] responsive.’
61.transliteration: wa-ʾilā thamūda ʾakhāhum ṣāliḥan qāla yā-qawmi ʿbudū llāha mā lakum min ʾilāhin ghayruhū huwa ʾanshaʾakum mina l-ʾarḍi wa-staʿmarakum fīhā fa-staghfirūhu thumma tūbū ʾilayhi ʾinna rabbī qarībun mujībun

62.content: قالوا يا صالِحُ قَد كُنتَ فينا مَرجُوًّا قَبلَ هٰذا ۖ أَتَنهانا أَن نَعبُدَ ما يَعبُدُ آباؤُنا وَإِنَّنا لَفي شَكٍّ مِمّا تَدعونا إِلَيهِ مُريبٍ
62.translation_eng: They said, ‘O Ṣāliḥ! You were a source of hope to us before this. Do you forbid us to worship what our fathers have been worshiping? Indeed we have grave doubts concerning that to which you invite us.’
62.transliteration: qālū yā-ṣāliḥu qad kunta fīnā marjuwwan qabla hādhā ʾa-tanhānā ʾan naʿbuda mā yaʿbudu ʾābāʾunā wa-ʾinnanā la-fī shakkin mimmā tadʿūnā ʾilayhi murībin

63.content: قالَ يا قَومِ أَرَأَيتُم إِن كُنتُ عَلىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِن رَبّي وَآتاني مِنهُ رَحمَةً فَمَن يَنصُرُني مِنَ اللَّهِ إِن عَصَيتُهُ ۖ فَما تَزيدونَني غَيرَ تَخسيرٍ
63.translation_eng: He said, ‘O my people! Tell me, should I stand on a manifest proof from my Lord, and He has granted me His own mercy, who will protect me from Allah should I disobey Him? For then you will increase me in nothing but loss.
63.transliteration: qāla yā-qawmi ʾa-raʾaytum ʾin kuntu ʿalā bayyinatin min rabbī wa-ʾātānī minhu raḥmatan fa-man yanṣurunī mina llāhi ʾin ʿaṣaytuhū fa-mā tazīdūnanī ghayra takhsīrin

64.content: وَيا قَومِ هٰذِهِ ناقَةُ اللَّهِ لَكُم آيَةً فَذَروها تَأكُل في أَرضِ اللَّهِ وَلا تَمَسّوها بِسوءٍ فَيَأخُذَكُم عَذابٌ قَريبٌ
64.translation_eng: O my people! This she-camel of Allah is a sign for you. Let her graze [freely] in Allah’s land, and do not cause her any harm, for then you shall be seized by a prompt punishment.’
64.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi hādhihī nāqatu llāhi lakum ʾāyatan fa-dharūhā taʾkul fī ʾarḍi llāhi wa-lā tamassūhā bi-sūʾin fa-yaʾkhudhakum ʿadhābun qarībun

65.content: فَعَقَروها فَقالَ تَمَتَّعوا في دارِكُم ثَلاثَةَ أَيّامٍ ۖ ذٰلِكَ وَعدٌ غَيرُ مَكذوبٍ
65.translation_eng: But they hamstrung her, whereupon he said, ‘Enjoy yourselves in your homes for three days: that is a promise not to be belied!’
65.transliteration: fa-ʿaqarūhā fa-qāla tamattaʿū fī dārikum thalāthata ʾayyāmin dhālika waʿdun ghayru makdhūbin

66.content: فَلَمّا جاءَ أَمرُنا نَجَّينا صالِحًا وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا مَعَهُ بِرَحمَةٍ مِنّا وَمِن خِزيِ يَومِئِذٍ ۗ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ القَوِيُّ العَزيزُ
66.translation_eng: So when Our edict came, We delivered Ṣāliḥ and the faithful who were with him by a mercy from Us, and from the [punishment and] disgrace of that day. Your Lord is indeed the All-strong, the All-mighty.
66.transliteration: fa-lammā jāʾa ʾamrunā najjaynā ṣāliḥan wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū maʿahū bi-raḥmatin minnā wa-min khizyi yawmiʾidhin ʾinna rabbaka huwa l-qawiyyu l-ʿazīzu

67.content: وَأَخَذَ الَّذينَ ظَلَمُوا الصَّيحَةُ فَأَصبَحوا في دِيارِهِم جاثِمينَ
67.translation_eng: The Cry seized those who were wrongdoers, and they lay lifeless prostrate in their homes,
67.transliteration: wa-ʾakhadha lladhīna ẓalamū ṣ-ṣayḥatu fa-ʾaṣbaḥū fī diyārihim jāthimīna

68.content: كَأَن لَم يَغنَوا فيها ۗ أَلا إِنَّ ثَمودَ كَفَروا رَبَّهُم ۗ أَلا بُعدًا لِثَمودَ
68.translation_eng: as if they had never lived there. Look! Indeed Thamūd defied their Lord. Look! Away with Thamūd!
68.transliteration: ka-ʾan lam yaghnaw fīhā ʾa-lā ʾinna thamūda kafarū rabbahum ʾa-lā buʿdan li-thamūda

69.content: وَلَقَد جاءَت رُسُلُنا إِبراهيمَ بِالبُشرىٰ قالوا سَلامًا ۖ قالَ سَلامٌ ۖ فَما لَبِثَ أَن جاءَ بِعِجلٍ حَنيذٍ
69.translation_eng: Certainly Our messengers came to Abraham with the good news, and said, ‘Peace!’ ‘Peace!’ He replied. Presently he brought [for them] a roasted calf.
69.transliteration: wa-la-qad jāʾat rusulunā ʾibrāhīma bi-l-bushrā qālū salāman qāla salāmun fa-mā labitha ʾan jāʾa bi-ʿijlin ḥanīdhin

70.content: فَلَمّا رَأىٰ أَيدِيَهُم لا تَصِلُ إِلَيهِ نَكِرَهُم وَأَوجَسَ مِنهُم خيفَةً ۚ قالوا لا تَخَف إِنّا أُرسِلنا إِلىٰ قَومِ لوطٍ
70.translation_eng: But when he saw their hands not reaching for it, he took them amiss and felt a fear of them. They said, ‘Do not be afraid. We have been sent to the people of Lot.’
70.transliteration: fa-lammā raʾā ʾaydiyahum lā taṣilu ʾilayhi nakirahum wa-ʾawjasa minhum khīfatan qālū lā takhaf ʾinnā ʾursilnā ʾilā qawmi lūṭin

71.content: وَامرَأَتُهُ قائِمَةٌ فَضَحِكَت فَبَشَّرناها بِإِسحاقَ وَمِن وَراءِ إِسحاقَ يَعقوبَ
71.translation_eng: His wife, standing by, laughed as We gave her the good news of [the birth of] Isaac, and of Jacob, after Isaac.
71.transliteration: wa-mraʾatuhū qāʾimatun fa-ḍaḥikat fa-bashsharnāhā bi-ʾisḥāqa wa-min warāʾi ʾisḥāqa yaʿqūba

72.content: قالَت يا وَيلَتىٰ أَأَلِدُ وَأَنا عَجوزٌ وَهٰذا بَعلي شَيخًا ۖ إِنَّ هٰذا لَشَيءٌ عَجيبٌ
72.translation_eng: She said, ‘Oh, my! Shall I, an old woman, bear [children], and [while] this husband of mine is an old man?! That is indeed an odd thing!’
72.transliteration: qālat yā-waylatā ʾa-ʾalidu wa-ʾana ʿajūzun wa-hādhā baʿlī shaykhan ʾinna hādhā la-shayʾun ʿajībun

73.content: قالوا أَتَعجَبينَ مِن أَمرِ اللَّهِ ۖ رَحمَتُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ عَلَيكُم أَهلَ البَيتِ ۚ إِنَّهُ حَميدٌ مَجيدٌ
73.translation_eng: They said, ‘Are you amazed at Allah’s dispensation? [That is] Allah’s mercy and His blessings upon you, members of the household. Indeed He is all-laudable, all-glorious.’
73.transliteration: qālū ʾa-taʿjabīna min ʾamri llāhi raḥmatu llāhi wa-barakātuhū ʿalaykum ʾahla l-bayti ʾinnahū ḥamīdun majīdun

74.content: فَلَمّا ذَهَبَ عَن إِبراهيمَ الرَّوعُ وَجاءَتهُ البُشرىٰ يُجادِلُنا في قَومِ لوطٍ
74.translation_eng: So when the awe had left Abraham and the good news had reached him, he pleaded with Us concerning the people of Lot.
74.transliteration: fa-lammā dhahaba ʿan ʾibrāhīma r-rawʿu wa-jāʾathu l-bushrā yujādilunā fī qawmi lūṭin

75.translation_eng: Abraham was indeed most forbearing, plaintive, [and] penitent.

76.content: يا إِبراهيمُ أَعرِض عَن هٰذا ۖ إِنَّهُ قَد جاءَ أَمرُ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَإِنَّهُم آتيهِم عَذابٌ غَيرُ مَردودٍ
76.translation_eng: ‘O Abraham, let this matter alone! Your Lord’s edict has certainly come, and an irrevocable punishment shall overtake them.’
76.transliteration: yā-ʾibrāhīmu ʾaʿriḍ ʿan hādhā ʾinnahū qad jāʾa ʾamru rabbika wa-ʾinnahum ʾātīhim ʿadhābun ghayru mardūdin

77.content: وَلَمّا جاءَت رُسُلُنا لوطًا سيءَ بِهِم وَضاقَ بِهِم ذَرعًا وَقالَ هٰذا يَومٌ عَصيبٌ
77.translation_eng: When Our messengers came to Lot, he was distressed on their account and in a predicament for their sake, and he said, ‘This is a terrible day!’
77.transliteration: wa-lammā jāʾat rusulunā lūṭan sīʾa bihim wa-ḍāqa bihim dharʿan wa-qāla hādhā yawmun ʿaṣībun

78.content: وَجاءَهُ قَومُهُ يُهرَعونَ إِلَيهِ وَمِن قَبلُ كانوا يَعمَلونَ السَّيِّئَاتِ ۚ قالَ يا قَومِ هٰؤُلاءِ بَناتي هُنَّ أَطهَرُ لَكُم ۖ فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَلا تُخزونِ في ضَيفي ۖ أَلَيسَ مِنكُم رَجُلٌ رَشيدٌ
78.translation_eng: Then his people came running toward him, and they had been committing vices aforetime. He said, ‘O my people, these are my daughters: they are purer for you.1 Be wary of Allah and do not humiliate me with regard to my guests. Is there not a right-minded man among you?’That is, it would be purer for you to get married to them.
78.transliteration: wa-jāʾahū qawmuhū yuhraʿūna ʾilayhi wa-min qablu kānū yaʿmalūna s-sayyiʾāti qāla yā-qawmi hāʾulāʾi banātī hunna ʾaṭharu lakum fa-ttaqū llāha wa-lā tukhzūni fī ḍayfī ʾa-laysa minkum rajulun rashīdun

79.content: قالوا لَقَد عَلِمتَ ما لَنا في بَناتِكَ مِن حَقٍّ وَإِنَّكَ لَتَعلَمُ ما نُريدُ
79.translation_eng: They said, ‘You certainly know that we have no interest in your daughters, and indeed you know what we want.’
79.transliteration: qālū la-qad ʿalimta mā lanā fī banātika min ḥaqqin wa-ʾinnaka la-taʿlamu mā nurīdu

80.content: قالَ لَو أَنَّ لي بِكُم قُوَّةً أَو آوي إِلىٰ رُكنٍ شَديدٍ
80.translation_eng: He said, ‘If only I had the power to deter you, or could take refuge in a mighty support!’
80.transliteration: qāla law ʾanna lī bikum quwwatan ʾaw ʾāwī ʾilā ruknin shadīdin

81.content: قالوا يا لوطُ إِنّا رُسُلُ رَبِّكَ لَن يَصِلوا إِلَيكَ ۖ فَأَسرِ بِأَهلِكَ بِقِطعٍ مِنَ اللَّيلِ وَلا يَلتَفِت مِنكُم أَحَدٌ إِلَّا امرَأَتَكَ ۖ إِنَّهُ مُصيبُها ما أَصابَهُم ۚ إِنَّ مَوعِدَهُمُ الصُّبحُ ۚ أَلَيسَ الصُّبحُ بِقَريبٍ
81.translation_eng: They said, ‘O Lot, we are messengers of your Lord. They will never get at you. Set out with your family in a watch of the night; and none of you shall turn round, except your wife; indeed she will be struck by what strikes them. Indeed their tryst is the dawn. Is not the dawn [already] near?’
81.transliteration: qālū yā-lūṭu ʾinnā rusulu rabbika lan yaṣilū ʾilayka fa-ʾasri bi-ʾahlika bi-qiṭʿin mina l-layli wa-lā yaltafit minkum ʾaḥadun ʾillā mraʾataka ʾinnahū muṣībuhā mā ʾaṣābahum ʾinna mawʿidahumu ṣ-ṣubḥu ʾa-laysa ṣ-ṣubḥu bi-qarībin

82.content: فَلَمّا جاءَ أَمرُنا جَعَلنا عالِيَها سافِلَها وَأَمطَرنا عَلَيها حِجارَةً مِن سِجّيلٍ مَنضودٍ
82.translation_eng: So when Our edict came, We made its1 topmost part its nethermost, and We rained on it stones of laminar shale,That is, of the city of Sodom.
82.transliteration: fa-lammā jāʾa ʾamrunā jaʿalnā ʿāliyahā sāfilahā wa-ʾamṭarnā ʿalayhā ḥijāratan min sijjīlin manḍūdin

83.content: مُسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَما هِيَ مِنَ الظّالِمينَ بِبَعيدٍ
83.translation_eng: marked1 with your Lord [for the profligate],2 never far from the wrongdoers.Or ‘targeted.’Cf. 51:34.
83.transliteration: musawwamatan ʿinda rabbika wa-mā hiya mina ẓ-ẓālimīna bi-baʿīdin

84.content: ۞ وَإِلىٰ مَديَنَ أَخاهُم شُعَيبًا ۚ قالَ يا قَومِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلٰهٍ غَيرُهُ ۖ وَلا تَنقُصُوا المِكيالَ وَالميزانَ ۚ إِنّي أَراكُم بِخَيرٍ وَإِنّي أَخافُ عَلَيكُم عَذابَ يَومٍ مُحيطٍ
84.translation_eng: And to Midian [We sent] Shuʿayb, their brother. He said, ‘O my people! Worship Allah. You have no other god besides Him. Do not diminish the measure or the balance. Indeed I see that you are faring well, but I fear for you the punishment of an all-embracing day.’
84.transliteration: wa-ʾilā madyana ʾakhāhum shuʿayban qāla yā-qawmi ʿbudū llāha mā lakum min ʾilāhin ghayruhū wa-lā tanquṣū l-mikyāla wa-l-mīzāna ʾinnī ʾarākum bi-khayrin wa-ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʿalaykum ʿadhāba yawmin muḥīṭin

85.content: وَيا قَومِ أَوفُوا المِكيالَ وَالميزانَ بِالقِسطِ ۖ وَلا تَبخَسُوا النّاسَ أَشياءَهُم وَلا تَعثَوا فِي الأَرضِ مُفسِدينَ
85.translation_eng: ‘O my people! Observe fully the measure and the balance, with justice, and do not cheat the people of their goods,1 and do not act wickedly on the earth, causing corruption.’That is, by employing short weights and measures.
85.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi ʾawfū l-mikyāla wa-l-mīzāna bi-l-qisṭi wa-lā tabkhasū n-nāsa ʾashyāʾahum wa-lā taʿthaw fī l-ʾarḍi mufsidīna

86.content: بَقِيَّتُ اللَّهِ خَيرٌ لَكُم إِن كُنتُم مُؤمِنينَ ۚ وَما أَنا عَلَيكُم بِحَفيظٍ
86.translation_eng: ‘What remains of Allah’s provision1 is better for you, should you be faithful, and I am not a keeper over you.’That is, of your lawful earnings.
86.transliteration: baqiyyatu llāhi khayrun lakum ʾin kuntum muʾminīna wa-mā ʾana ʿalaykum bi-ḥafīẓin

87.content: قالوا يا شُعَيبُ أَصَلاتُكَ تَأمُرُكَ أَن نَترُكَ ما يَعبُدُ آباؤُنا أَو أَن نَفعَلَ في أَموالِنا ما نَشاءُ ۖ إِنَّكَ لَأَنتَ الحَليمُ الرَّشيدُ
87.translation_eng: They said, ‘O Shuʿayb, does your worship require that we abandon what our fathers have been worshiping, or that we should not do with our wealth whatever we wish? You are indeed [a] gentle and sensible [person].’
87.transliteration: qālū yā-shuʿaybu ʾa-ṣalātuka taʾmuruka ʾan natruka mā yaʿbudu ʾābāʾunā ʾaw ʾan nafʿala fī ʾamwālinā mā nashāʾu ʾinnaka la-ʾanta l-ḥalīmu r-rashīdu

88.content: قالَ يا قَومِ أَرَأَيتُم إِن كُنتُ عَلىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِن رَبّي وَرَزَقَني مِنهُ رِزقًا حَسَنًا ۚ وَما أُريدُ أَن أُخالِفَكُم إِلىٰ ما أَنهاكُم عَنهُ ۚ إِن أُريدُ إِلَّا الإِصلاحَ مَا استَطَعتُ ۚ وَما تَوفيقي إِلّا بِاللَّهِ ۚ عَلَيهِ تَوَكَّلتُ وَإِلَيهِ أُنيبُ
88.translation_eng: He said, ‘O my people! Have you considered, should I stand on a manifest proof from my Lord, who has provided me a good provision from Himself?1 I do not wish to oppose you by what I forbid you. I only desire to put things in order, as far as I can, and my success lies only with Allah: in Him I have put my trust, and to Him I turn penitently.That is, ‘If I stand on a clear proof from my Lord, who has provided me with lawful means of livelihood, is it a right thing for you to reject my call to faith in Allah and fair dealing?’
88.transliteration: qāla yā-qawmi ʾa-raʾaytum ʾin kuntu ʿalā bayyinatin min rabbī wa-razaqanī minhu rizqan ḥasanan wa-mā ʾurīdu ʾan ʾukhālifakum ʾilā mā ʾanhākum ʿanhu ʾin ʾurīdu ʾillā l-ʾiṣlāḥa mā staṭaʿtu wa-mā tawfīqī ʾillā bi-llāhi ʿalayhi tawakkaltu wa-ʾilayhi ʾunību

89.content: وَيا قَومِ لا يَجرِمَنَّكُم شِقاقي أَن يُصيبَكُم مِثلُ ما أَصابَ قَومَ نوحٍ أَو قَومَ هودٍ أَو قَومَ صالِحٍ ۚ وَما قَومُ لوطٍ مِنكُم بِبَعيدٍ
89.translation_eng: O my people, do not let your defiance toward me lead you to be visited by the like of what was visited on the people of Noah, or the people of Hūd, or the people of Ṣāliḥ, and the people of Lot are not distant from you.
89.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi lā yajrimannakum shiqāqī ʾan yuṣībakum mithlu mā ʾaṣāba qawma nūḥin ʾaw qawma hūdin ʾaw qawma ṣāliḥin wa-mā qawmu lūṭin minkum bi-baʿīdin

90.content: وَاستَغفِروا رَبَّكُم ثُمَّ توبوا إِلَيهِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي رَحيمٌ وَدودٌ
90.translation_eng: Plead with your Lord for forgiveness, then turn to Him penitently. My Lord is indeed all-merciful, all-affectionate.’
90.transliteration: wa-staghfirū rabbakum thumma tūbū ʾilāyhi ʾinna rabbī raḥīmun wadūdun

91.content: قالوا يا شُعَيبُ ما نَفقَهُ كَثيرًا مِمّا تَقولُ وَإِنّا لَنَراكَ فينا ضَعيفًا ۖ وَلَولا رَهطُكَ لَرَجَمناكَ ۖ وَما أَنتَ عَلَينا بِعَزيزٍ
91.translation_eng: They said, ‘O Shuʿayb, we do not understand much of what you say. Indeed we see you are weak amongst us, and were it not for your tribe, we would have stoned you, and you are not venerable to us.’
91.transliteration: qālū yā-shuʿaybu mā nafqahu kathīran mimmā taqūlu wa-ʾinnā la-narāka fīnā ḍaʿīfan wa-law-lā rahṭuka la-rajamnāka wa-mā ʾanta ʿalaynā bi-ʿazīzin

92.content: قالَ يا قَومِ أَرَهطي أَعَزُّ عَلَيكُم مِنَ اللَّهِ وَاتَّخَذتُموهُ وَراءَكُم ظِهرِيًّا ۖ إِنَّ رَبّي بِما تَعمَلونَ مُحيطٌ
92.translation_eng: He said, ‘O my people! Is my tribe more venerable in your sight than Allah, to whom you pay no regard? Indeed my Lord comprehends whatever you do.
92.transliteration: qāla yā-qawmi ʾa-rahṭī ʾaʿazzu ʿalaykum mina llāhi wa-ttakhadhtumūhu warāʾakum ẓihriyyan ʾinna rabbī bi-mā taʿmalūna muḥīṭun

93.content: وَيا قَومِ اعمَلوا عَلىٰ مَكانَتِكُم إِنّي عامِلٌ ۖ سَوفَ تَعلَمونَ مَن يَأتيهِ عَذابٌ يُخزيهِ وَمَن هُوَ كاذِبٌ ۖ وَارتَقِبوا إِنّي مَعَكُم رَقيبٌ
93.translation_eng: O my people! Act according to your ability; I too am acting. Soon you will know who will be overtaken by a punishment that will disgrace him, and who is a liar. So be on the watch; I too will be watching along with you.’
93.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi ʿmalū ʿalā makānatikum ʾinnī ʿāmilun sawfa taʿlamūna man yaʾtīhi ʿadhābun yukhzīhi wa-man huwa kādhibun wa-rtaqibū ʾinnī maʿakum raqībun

94.content: وَلَمّا جاءَ أَمرُنا نَجَّينا شُعَيبًا وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا مَعَهُ بِرَحمَةٍ مِنّا وَأَخَذَتِ الَّذينَ ظَلَمُوا الصَّيحَةُ فَأَصبَحوا في دِيارِهِم جاثِمينَ
94.translation_eng: And when Our edict came, We delivered Shuʿayb and the faithful who were with him by a mercy from Us. And the Cry seized those who were wrongdoers, whereat they lay lifeless prostrate in their homes,
94.transliteration: wa-lammā jāʾa ʾamrunā najjaynā shuʿayban wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū maʿahū bi-raḥmatin minnā wa-ʾakhadhati lladhīna ẓalamū ṣ-ṣayḥatu fa-ʾaṣbaḥū fī diyārihim jāthimīna

95.content: كَأَن لَم يَغنَوا فيها ۗ أَلا بُعدًا لِمَديَنَ كَما بَعِدَت ثَمودُ
95.translation_eng: as if they had never lived there. Look! Away with Midian! —just as Thamūd was done away with!
95.transliteration: ka-ʾan lam yaghnaw fīhā ʾa-lā buʿdan li-madyana ka-mā baʿidat thamūdu

96.content: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا موسىٰ بِآياتِنا وَسُلطانٍ مُبينٍ
96.translation_eng: Certainly We sent Moses with Our signs and a manifest authority
96.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾarsalnā mūsā bi-ʾāyātinā wa-sulṭānin mubīnin

97.content: إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ وَمَلَئِهِ فَاتَّبَعوا أَمرَ فِرعَونَ ۖ وَما أَمرُ فِرعَونَ بِرَشيدٍ
97.translation_eng: to Pharaoh and his elite, but they followed Pharaoh’s dictates, and Pharaoh’s dictates were not right-minded.
97.transliteration: ʾilā firʿawna wa-malaʾihī fa-ttabaʿū ʾamra firʿawna wa-mā ʾamru firʿawna bi-rashīdin

98.content: يَقدُمُ قَومَهُ يَومَ القِيامَةِ فَأَورَدَهُمُ النّارَ ۖ وَبِئسَ الوِردُ المَورودُ
98.translation_eng: On the Day of Resurrection he will lead his people and conduct them into the Fire: an evil goal for the incoming!1Or ‘an evil watering place for the thirsty.’
98.transliteration: yaqdumu qawmahū yawma l-qiyāmati fa-ʾawradahumu n-nāra wa-biʾsa l-wirdu l-mawrūdu

99.content: وَأُتبِعوا في هٰذِهِ لَعنَةً وَيَومَ القِيامَةِ ۚ بِئسَ الرِّفدُ المَرفودُ
99.translation_eng: They were pursued by a curse in this [world], as well as on the Day of Resurrection; evil is the award conferred [upon them]!
99.transliteration: wa-ʾutbiʿū fī hādhihī laʿnatan wa-yawma l-qiyāmati biʾsa r-rifdu l-marfūdu

100.content: ذٰلِكَ مِن أَنباءِ القُرىٰ نَقُصُّهُ عَلَيكَ ۖ مِنها قائِمٌ وَحَصيدٌ
100.translation_eng: These are from the accounts of the townships which We recount to you. Of them there are some that still stand, and some that have been mown down.
100.transliteration: dhālika min ʾanbāʾi l-qurā naquṣṣuhū ʿalayka minhā qāʾimun wa-ḥaṣīdun

101.content: وَما ظَلَمناهُم وَلٰكِن ظَلَموا أَنفُسَهُم ۖ فَما أَغنَت عَنهُم آلِهَتُهُمُ الَّتي يَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ مِن شَيءٍ لَمّا جاءَ أَمرُ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَما زادوهُم غَيرَ تَتبيبٍ
101.translation_eng: We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves. Of no avail to them were their gods whom they would invoke besides Allah, in any wise, when your Lord’s edict came, and they1 did not increase them in anything but ruin.That is, their false gods.
101.transliteration: wa-mā ẓalamnāhum wa-lākin ẓalamū ʾanfusahum fa-mā ʾaghnat ʿanhum ʾālihatuhumu llatī yadʿūna min dūni llāhi min shayʾin lammā jāʾa ʾamru rabbika wa-mā zādūhum ghayra tatbībin

102.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ أَخذُ رَبِّكَ إِذا أَخَذَ القُرىٰ وَهِيَ ظالِمَةٌ ۚ إِنَّ أَخذَهُ أَليمٌ شَديدٌ
102.translation_eng: Such is the seizing of your Lord when He seizes the townships that are wrongdoing. Indeed His seizing is painful, severe.
102.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika ʾakhdhu rabbika ʾidhā ʾakhadha l-qurā wa-hiya ẓālimatun ʾinna ʾakhdhahū ʾalīmun shadīdun

103.content: إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِمَن خافَ عَذابَ الآخِرَةِ ۚ ذٰلِكَ يَومٌ مَجموعٌ لَهُ النّاسُ وَذٰلِكَ يَومٌ مَشهودٌ
103.translation_eng: There is indeed a sign in that for him who fears the punishment of the Hereafter. That is a day on which all mankind will be gathered, and it is a day witnessed [by all creatures].
103.transliteration: ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan li-man khāfa ʿadhāba l-ʾākhirati dhālika yawmun majmūʿun lahu n-nāsu wa-dhālika yawmun mashhūdun

104.translation_eng: And We do not defer it but for a determinate term.

105.content: يَومَ يَأتِ لا تَكَلَّمُ نَفسٌ إِلّا بِإِذنِهِ ۚ فَمِنهُم شَقِيٌّ وَسَعيدٌ
105.translation_eng: The day it comes, no one shall speak except by His leave. [On that day,] some of them will be wretched and [some] felicitous.
105.transliteration: yawma yaʾti lā takallamu nafsun ʾillā bi-ʾidhnihī fa-minhum shaqiyyun wa-saʿīdun

106.content: فَأَمَّا الَّذينَ شَقوا فَفِي النّارِ لَهُم فيها زَفيرٌ وَشَهيقٌ
106.translation_eng: As for the wretched, they shall be in the Fire: their lot therein will be groaning and wailing.
106.transliteration: fa-ʾammā lladhīna shaqū fa-fī n-nāri lahum fīhā zafīrun wa-shahīqun

107.content: خالِدينَ فيها ما دامَتِ السَّماواتُ وَالأَرضُ إِلّا ما شاءَ رَبُّكَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ فَعّالٌ لِما يُريدُ
107.translation_eng: They shall remain in it for as long as the heavens and the earth endure —except what your Lord may wish; indeed your Lord does whatever He desires.
107.transliteration: khālidīna fīhā mā dāmati s-samāwātu wa-l-ʾarḍu ʾillā mā shāʾa rabbuka ʾinna rabbaka faʿʿālun li-mā yurīdu

108.content: ۞ وَأَمَّا الَّذينَ سُعِدوا فَفِي الجَنَّةِ خالِدينَ فيها ما دامَتِ السَّماواتُ وَالأَرضُ إِلّا ما شاءَ رَبُّكَ ۖ عَطاءً غَيرَ مَجذوذٍ
108.translation_eng: As for the felicitous, they will be in paradise. They will remain in it for as long as the heavens and the earth endure —except what your Lord may wish— an endless bounty.
108.transliteration: wa-ʾammā lladhīna suʿidū fa-fī l-jannati khālidīna fīhā mā dāmati s-samāwātu wa-l-ʾarḍu ʾillā mā shāʾa rabbuka ʿaṭāʾan ghayra majdhūdhin

109.content: فَلا تَكُ في مِريَةٍ مِمّا يَعبُدُ هٰؤُلاءِ ۚ ما يَعبُدونَ إِلّا كَما يَعبُدُ آباؤُهُم مِن قَبلُ ۚ وَإِنّا لَمُوَفّوهُم نَصيبَهُم غَيرَ مَنقوصٍ
109.translation_eng: So do not be in doubt about what these1 worship: they worship just as their fathers worshiped before, and We shall surely pay them their full share, undiminished.That is, the idolaters of Arabia.
109.transliteration: fa-lā taku fī miryatin mimmā yaʿbudu hāʾulāʾi mā yaʿbudūna ʾillā ka-mā yaʿbudu ʾābāʾuhum min qablu wa-ʾinnā la-muwaffūhum naṣībahum ghayra manqūṣin

110.content: وَلَقَد آتَينا موسَى الكِتابَ فَاختُلِفَ فيهِ ۚ وَلَولا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَت مِن رَبِّكَ لَقُضِيَ بَينَهُم ۚ وَإِنَّهُم لَفي شَكٍّ مِنهُ مُريبٍ
110.translation_eng: Certainly We gave Moses the Book, but differences arose about it, and were it not for a prior decree of your Lord, a decision would have been made between them; indeed they are in grave doubt concerning it.
110.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynā mūsā l-kitāba fa-khtulifa fīhi wa-law-lā kalimatun sabaqat min rabbika la-quḍiya baynahum wa-ʾinnahum la-fī shakkin minhu murībin

111.content: وَإِنَّ كُلًّا لَمّا لَيُوَفِّيَنَّهُم رَبُّكَ أَعمالَهُم ۚ إِنَّهُ بِما يَعمَلونَ خَبيرٌ
111.translation_eng: Your Lord will indeed recompense everyone fully for their works. Indeed He is well aware of what they do.
111.transliteration: wa-ʾinna kullan lammā la-yuwaffiyannahum rabbuka ʾaʿmālahum ʾinnahū bi-mā yaʿmalūna khabīrun

112.content: فَاستَقِم كَما أُمِرتَ وَمَن تابَ مَعَكَ وَلا تَطغَوا ۚ إِنَّهُ بِما تَعمَلونَ بَصيرٌ
112.translation_eng: So be steadfast, just as you have been commanded— [you] and whoever has turned [to Allah] with you— and do not overstep the bounds. Indeed He sees best what you do.
112.transliteration: fa-staqim ka-mā ʾumirta wa-man tāba maʿaka wa-lā taṭghaw ʾinnahū bi-mā taʿmalūna baṣīrun

113.content: وَلا تَركَنوا إِلَى الَّذينَ ظَلَموا فَتَمَسَّكُمُ النّارُ وَما لَكُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ مِن أَولِياءَ ثُمَّ لا تُنصَرونَ
113.translation_eng: And do not incline toward the wrongdoers, lest the Fire should touch you, and you will not have any friend besides Allah, then you will not be helped.
113.transliteration: wa-lā tarkanū ʾilā lladhīna ẓalamū fa-tamassakumu n-nāru wa-mā lakum min dūni llāhi min ʾawliyāʾa thumma lā tunṣarūna

114.content: وَأَقِمِ الصَّلاةَ طَرَفَيِ النَّهارِ وَزُلَفًا مِنَ اللَّيلِ ۚ إِنَّ الحَسَناتِ يُذهِبنَ السَّيِّئَاتِ ۚ ذٰلِكَ ذِكرىٰ لِلذّاكِرينَ
114.translation_eng: Maintain the prayer at the two ends of the day,1 and during the early hours of the night. Indeed good deeds efface misdeeds.2 That is an admonition for the mindful.That is, at dawn and sunset.Or ‘Indeed good deeds remove ills,’ or ‘Indeed virtues efface vices.’
114.transliteration: wa-ʾaqimi ṣ-ṣalāta ṭarafayi n-nahāri wa-zulafan mina l-layli ʾinna l-ḥasanāti yudhhibna s-sayyiʾāti dhālika dhikrā li-dh-dhākirīna

115.content: وَاصبِر فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُضيعُ أَجرَ المُحسِنينَ
115.translation_eng: And be patient; indeed Allah does not waste the reward of the virtuous.
