115.transliteration: wa-ṣbir fa-ʾinna llāha lā yuḍīʿu ʾajra l-muḥsinīna

116.content: فَلَولا كانَ مِنَ القُرونِ مِن قَبلِكُم أُولو بَقِيَّةٍ يَنهَونَ عَنِ الفَسادِ فِي الأَرضِ إِلّا قَليلًا مِمَّن أَنجَينا مِنهُم ۗ وَاتَّبَعَ الَّذينَ ظَلَموا ما أُترِفوا فيهِ وَكانوا مُجرِمينَ
116.translation_eng: Why were there not among the generations before you a remnant [of the wise] who might forbid corruption in the earth, except a few of those whom We delivered from among them? Those who were wrongdoers pursued that in which they had been granted affluence, and they were a guilty lot.
116.transliteration: fa-law-lā kāna mina l-qurūni min qablikum ʾulū baqiyyatin yanhawna ʿani l-fasādi fī l-ʾarḍi ʾillā qalīlan mimman ʾanjaynā minhum wa-ttabaʿa lladhīna ẓalamū mā ʾutrifū fīhi wa-kānū mujrimīna

117.content: وَما كانَ رَبُّكَ لِيُهلِكَ القُرىٰ بِظُلمٍ وَأَهلُها مُصلِحونَ
117.translation_eng: Your Lord would never destroy the townships unjustly while their inhabitants were bringing about reform.
117.transliteration: wa-mā kāna rabbuka li-yuhlika l-qurā bi-ẓulmin wa-ʾahluhā muṣliḥūna

118.content: وَلَو شاءَ رَبُّكَ لَجَعَلَ النّاسَ أُمَّةً واحِدَةً ۖ وَلا يَزالونَ مُختَلِفينَ
118.translation_eng: Had your Lord wished, He would have made mankind one community; but they continue to differ,
118.transliteration: wa-law shāʾa rabbuka la-jaʿala n-nāsa ʾummatan wāḥidatan wa-lā yazālūna mukhtalifīna

119.content: إِلّا مَن رَحِمَ رَبُّكَ ۚ وَلِذٰلِكَ خَلَقَهُم ۗ وَتَمَّت كَلِمَةُ رَبِّكَ لَأَملَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنَ الجِنَّةِ وَالنّاسِ أَجمَعينَ
119.translation_eng: except those on whom your Lord has mercy —and that is why He created them— and the word of your Lord has been fulfilled: ‘I will surely fill hell with jinn and humans, all together!’1That is, all of those who are followers of Satan. See 38:85.
119.transliteration: ʾillā man raḥima rabbuka wa-li-dhālika khalaqahum wa-tammat kalimatu rabbika la-ʾamlaʾanna jahannama mina l-jinnati wa-n-nāsi ʾajmaʿīna

120.content: وَكُلًّا نَقُصُّ عَلَيكَ مِن أَنباءِ الرُّسُلِ ما نُثَبِّتُ بِهِ فُؤادَكَ ۚ وَجاءَكَ في هٰذِهِ الحَقُّ وَمَوعِظَةٌ وَذِكرىٰ لِلمُؤمِنينَ
120.translation_eng: Whatever We relate to you of the accounts of the apostles are those by which We strengthen your heart, and there has come to you in this [sūrah] the truth and an advice and admonition for the faithful.
120.transliteration: wa-kullan naquṣṣu ʿalayka min ʾanbāʾi r-rusuli mā nuthabbitu bihī fuʾādaka wa-jāʾaka fī hādhihi l-ḥaqqu wa-mawʿiẓatun wa-dhikrā li-l-muʾminīna

121.content: وَقُل لِلَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ اعمَلوا عَلىٰ مَكانَتِكُم إِنّا عامِلونَ
121.translation_eng: And say to those who do not have faith, ‘Act according to your ability; we too are acting.
121.transliteration: wa-qul li-lladhīna lā yuʾminūna ʿmalū ʿalā makānatikum ʾinnā ʿāmilūna

122.translation_eng: And wait! We too are waiting.’

123.content: وَلِلَّهِ غَيبُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَإِلَيهِ يُرجَعُ الأَمرُ كُلُّهُ فَاعبُدهُ وَتَوَكَّل عَلَيهِ ۚ وَما رَبُّكَ بِغافِلٍ عَمّا تَعمَلونَ
123.translation_eng: To Allah belongs the Unseen of the heavens and the earth, and to Him all matters are returned. So worship Him and trust in Him. Your Lord is not oblivious of what you do.
123.transliteration: wa-li-llāhi ghaybu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-ʾilayhi yurjaʿu l-ʾamru kulluhū fa-ʿbudhu wa-tawakkal ʿalayhi wa-mā rabbuka bi-ghāfilin ʿammā taʿmalūna

response.description: The surah that contains the first revealed verses of the Quran, reminding the human being of The Clinging Mass, a stage that reflects the miracle of human creation in the womb of the mother. The surah is also known by the first Quranic instruction: Read. It is named after “the clining mass” (ʿalaq) mentioned in verse 2. The first five verses are known to be the first revelation of the Quran when the Prophet Muhammad was instructed to read. The second part came later to show that man transgresses when he becomes self-satisfied.The surah is also known as: Clots of Blood, Proclaim, Read, Recite, The Blood-clot, The Clinging Clot, The Clinging Form, The Clot, The Embryo.

1.translation_eng: Read in the Name of your Lord who created;

2.translation_eng: created man from a clinging mass.

3.translation_eng: Read, and your Lord is the most generous,

5.translation_eng: taught man what he did not know.

7.translation_eng: when he considers himself without need.

8.translation_eng: Indeed to your Lord is the return.

11.translation_eng: tell me, should he be on [true] guidance,

13.translation_eng: tell me, should he call him a liar and turn away

14.translation_eng: —does he not know that Allah sees?

15.content: كَلّا لَئِن لَم يَنتَهِ لَنَسفَعًا بِالنّاصِيَةِ
15.translation_eng: No indeed! If he does not stop,We shall seize him by the forelock,
15.transliteration: kallā la-ʾin lam yantahi la-nasfaʿan bi-n-nāṣiyati

17.translation_eng: Then let him call out his gang!

18.translation_eng: We [too] shall call the keepers of hell.

19.translation_eng: No indeed! Do not obey him,but prostrate and draw near [to Allah]!

response.description: The only surah beginning with the discrete Arabic letters Alif Lām Mīm that also contains a ayah which requires one who recites it to perform a Prostration of bowing down to the ground before God in worship at the mention of God’s revealed signs. It takes its name from verse 15 which mentions “prostration” (sajdah). The surah emphasized the truth of the Quran at the beginning, and the Prophet is urged at the end of the surah to pay no attention to the disbelievers who cannot see the significance of God’s signs.The surah is also known as: Bowing Down, Bowing down in Worship, The Adoration, Worship.

2.content: تَنزيلُ الكِتابِ لا رَيبَ فيهِ مِن رَبِّ العالَمينَ
2.translation_eng: The [gradual] sending down of the Book, there is no doubt in it, is from the Lord of all the worlds.
2.transliteration: tanzīlu l-kitābi lā rayba fīhi min rabbi l-ʿālamīna

3.content: أَم يَقولونَ افتَراهُ ۚ بَل هُوَ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكَ لِتُنذِرَ قَومًا ما أَتاهُم مِن نَذيرٍ مِن قَبلِكَ لَعَلَّهُم يَهتَدونَ
3.translation_eng: Do they say, ‘He has fabricated it’? Rather it is the truth from your Lord, that you may warn a people to whom there did not come any warner before you, so that they may be guided [to the right path].
3.transliteration: ʾam yaqūlūna ftarāhu bal huwa l-ḥaqqu min rabbika li-tundhira qawman mā ʾatāhum min nadhīrin min qablika laʿallahum yahtadūna

4.content: اللَّهُ الَّذي خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ وَما بَينَهُما في سِتَّةِ أَيّامٍ ثُمَّ استَوىٰ عَلَى العَرشِ ۖ ما لَكُم مِن دونِهِ مِن وَلِيٍّ وَلا شَفيعٍ ۚ أَفَلا تَتَذَكَّرونَ
4.translation_eng: It is Allah who created the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them in six days,1 then He settled on the Throne. You do not have besides Him any guardian or intercessor. Will you not then take admonition?That is, in six periods of time. Cf. 57:4.
4.transliteration: allāhu lladhī khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa wa-mā baynahumā fī sittati ʾayyāmin thumma stawā ʿalā l-ʿarshi mā lakum min dūnihī min waliyyin wa-lā shafīʿin ʾa-fa-lā tatadhakkarūna

5.content: يُدَبِّرُ الأَمرَ مِنَ السَّماءِ إِلَى الأَرضِ ثُمَّ يَعرُجُ إِلَيهِ في يَومٍ كانَ مِقدارُهُ أَلفَ سَنَةٍ مِمّا تَعُدّونَ
5.translation_eng: He directs the command1 from the heaven to the earth; then it ascends toward Him in a day2 whose span is a thousand years by your reckoning.Cf. 10:3, 31; 13:2.That is, in a period of time.
5.transliteration: yudabbiru l-ʾamra mina s-samāʾi ʾilā l-ʾarḍi thumma yaʿruju ʾilayhi fī yawmin kāna miqdāruhū ʾalfa sanatin mimmā taʿuddūna

6.content: ذٰلِكَ عالِمُ الغَيبِ وَالشَّهادَةِ العَزيزُ الرَّحيمُ
6.translation_eng: That is the Knower of the sensible and the Unseen, the All-mighty, the All-merciful,
6.transliteration: dhālika ʿālimu l-ghaybi wa-sh-shahādati l-ʿazīzu r-raḥīmu

7.content: الَّذي أَحسَنَ كُلَّ شَيءٍ خَلَقَهُ ۖ وَبَدَأَ خَلقَ الإِنسانِ مِن طينٍ
7.translation_eng: who perfected everything that He created, and commenced man’s creation from clay.
7.transliteration: alladhī ʾaḥsana kulla shayʾin khalaqahū wa-badaʾa khalqa l-ʾinsāni min ṭīnin

8.content: ثُمَّ جَعَلَ نَسلَهُ مِن سُلالَةٍ مِن ماءٍ مَهينٍ
8.translation_eng: Then He made his progeny from an extract of a base fluid.
8.transliteration: thumma jaʿala naslahū min sulālatin min māʾin mahīnin

9.content: ثُمَّ سَوّاهُ وَنَفَخَ فيهِ مِن روحِهِ ۖ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ السَّمعَ وَالأَبصارَ وَالأَفئِدَةَ ۚ قَليلًا ما تَشكُرونَ
9.translation_eng: Then He proportioned him and breathed into him of His Spirit, and made for you the hearing, the sight, and the hearts. Little do you thank.
9.transliteration: thumma sawwāhu wa-nafakha fīhi min rūḥihī wa-jaʿala lakumu s-samʿa wa-l-ʾabṣāra wa-l-ʾafʾidata qalīlan mā tashkurūna

10.content: وَقالوا أَإِذا ضَلَلنا فِي الأَرضِ أَإِنّا لَفي خَلقٍ جَديدٍ ۚ بَل هُم بِلِقاءِ رَبِّهِم كافِرونَ
10.translation_eng: They say, ‘When we have been lost in the dust,1 shall we be indeed created anew?’ Rather they disbelieve in the encounter with their Lord.That is, ‘Shall we be brought forth again after our bodies have decomposed and all traces of our physical remains have disappeared in the ground?’
10.transliteration: wa-qālū ʾa-ʾidhā ḍalalnā fī l-ʾarḍi ʾa-ʾinnā la-fī khalqin jadīdin bal hum bi-liqāʾi rabbihim kāfirūna

11.content: ۞ قُل يَتَوَفّاكُم مَلَكُ المَوتِ الَّذي وُكِّلَ بِكُم ثُمَّ إِلىٰ رَبِّكُم تُرجَعونَ
11.translation_eng: Say, ‘You will be taken away by the angel of death, who has been charged with you. Then you will be brought back to your Lord.’
11.transliteration: qul yatawaffākum malaku l-mawti lladhī wukkila bikum thumma ʾilā rabbikum turjaʿūna

12.content: وَلَو تَرىٰ إِذِ المُجرِمونَ ناكِسو رُءوسِهِم عِندَ رَبِّهِم رَبَّنا أَبصَرنا وَسَمِعنا فَارجِعنا نَعمَل صالِحًا إِنّا موقِنونَ
12.translation_eng: Were you to see when the guilty hang their heads before their Lord [confessing], ‘Our Lord! We have seen and heard. Send us back so that we may act righteously. Indeed we are [now] convinced.’
12.transliteration: wa-law tarā ʾidhi l-mujrimūna nākisū ruʾūsihim ʿinda rabbihim rabbanā ʾabṣarnā wa-samiʿnā fa-rjiʿnā naʿmal ṣāliḥan ʾinnā mūqinūna

13.content: وَلَو شِئنا لَآتَينا كُلَّ نَفسٍ هُداها وَلٰكِن حَقَّ القَولُ مِنّي لَأَملَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنَ الجِنَّةِ وَالنّاسِ أَجمَعينَ
13.translation_eng: Had We wished We would have given every soul its guidance, but My word became due [against the defiant]: ‘Surely I will fill hell with all the [guilty] jinn and humans.’1Cf. 7:18; 11:119; 38:85.
13.transliteration: wa-law shiʾnā la-ʾātaynā kulla nafsin hudāhā wa-lākin ḥaqqa l-qawlu minnī la-ʾamlaʾanna jahannama mina l-jinnati wa-n-nāsi ʾajmaʿīna

14.content: فَذوقوا بِما نَسيتُم لِقاءَ يَومِكُم هٰذا إِنّا نَسيناكُم ۖ وَذوقوا عَذابَ الخُلدِ بِما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
14.translation_eng: So taste [the punishment] for your having forgotten the encounter of this day of yours. We [too] have forgotten you. Taste the everlasting punishment because of what you used to do.
14.transliteration: fa-dhūqū bi-mā nasītum liqāʾa yawmikum hādhā ʾinnā nasīnākum wa-dhūqū ʿadhāba l-khuldi bi-mā kuntum taʿmalūna

15.content: إِنَّما يُؤمِنُ بِآياتِنَا الَّذينَ إِذا ذُكِّروا بِها خَرّوا سُجَّدًا وَسَبَّحوا بِحَمدِ رَبِّهِم وَهُم لا يَستَكبِرونَ ۩
15.translation_eng: Only those believe in Our signs who, when they are reminded of them, fall down in prostration and celebrate the praise of their Lord, and they are not arrogant.
15.transliteration: ʾinnamā yuʾminu bi-ʾāyātinā lladhīna ʾidhā dhukkirū bihā kharrū sujjadan wa-sabbaḥū bi-ḥamdi rabbihim wa-hum lā yastakbirūna

16.content: تَتَجافىٰ جُنوبُهُم عَنِ المَضاجِعِ يَدعونَ رَبَّهُم خَوفًا وَطَمَعًا وَمِمّا رَزَقناهُم يُنفِقونَ
16.translation_eng: Their sides vacate their beds1 to supplicate their Lord in fear and hope, and they spend out of what We have provided them.That is, they abandon their beds at night and forgo the pleasure of sleep to worship their Lord in a state of fear and hope.
16.transliteration: tatajāfā junūbuhum ʿani l-maḍājiʿi yadʿūna rabbahum khawfan wa-ṭamaʿan wa-mimmā razaqnāhum yunfiqūna

17.content: فَلا تَعلَمُ نَفسٌ ما أُخفِيَ لَهُم مِن قُرَّةِ أَعيُنٍ جَزاءً بِما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
17.translation_eng: No one knows what has been kept hidden for them of comfort as a reward for what they used to do.
17.transliteration: fa-lā taʿlamu nafsun mā ʾukhfiya lahum min qurrati ʾaʿyunin jazāʾan bi-mā kānū yaʿmalūna

18.content: أَفَمَن كانَ مُؤمِنًا كَمَن كانَ فاسِقًا ۚ لا يَستَوونَ
18.translation_eng: Is someone who is faithful like someone who is a transgressor? They are not equal.
18.transliteration: ʾa-fa-man kāna muʾminan ka-man kāna fāsiqan lā yastawūna

19.content: أَمَّا الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ فَلَهُم جَنّاتُ المَأوىٰ نُزُلًا بِما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
19.translation_eng: As for those who have faith and do righteous deeds, for them are gardens of the Abode —a hospitality for what they used to do.
19.transliteration: ʾammā lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti fa-lahum jannātu l-maʾwā nuzulan bi-mā kānū yaʿmalūna

20.content: وَأَمَّا الَّذينَ فَسَقوا فَمَأواهُمُ النّارُ ۖ كُلَّما أَرادوا أَن يَخرُجوا مِنها أُعيدوا فيها وَقيلَ لَهُم ذوقوا عَذابَ النّارِ الَّذي كُنتُم بِهِ تُكَذِّبونَ
20.translation_eng: As for those who have transgressed, their refuge is the Fire. Whenever they seek to leave it, they will be turned back into it, and they will be told: ‘Taste the punishment of the Fire which you used to deny.’
20.transliteration: wa-ʾammā lladhīna fasaqū fa-maʾwāhumu n-nāru kullamā ʾarādū ʾan yakhrujū minhā ʾuʿīdū fīhā wa-qīla lahum dhūqū ʿadhāba n-nāri lladhī kuntum bihī tukadhdhibūna

21.content: وَلَنُذيقَنَّهُم مِنَ العَذابِ الأَدنىٰ دونَ العَذابِ الأَكبَرِ لَعَلَّهُم يَرجِعونَ
21.translation_eng: We shall surely make them taste the nearer punishment before the greater punishment,1 so that they may come back.2Or ‘this side of the greater punishment,’ or ‘aside from the greater punishment.’By ‘the nearer punishment’ is meant the afflictions and hardships the faithless may be made to suffer in the world with the purpose of bringing them back to Allah and in order to save them from the greater punishment of the Hereafter.
21.transliteration: wa-la-nudhīqannahum mina l-ʿadhābi l-ʾadnā dūna l-ʿadhābi l-ʾakbari laʿallahum yarjiʿūna

22.content: وَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّن ذُكِّرَ بِآياتِ رَبِّهِ ثُمَّ أَعرَضَ عَنها ۚ إِنّا مِنَ المُجرِمينَ مُنتَقِمونَ
22.translation_eng: Who is a greater wrongdoer than him who is reminded of his Lord’s signs, whereat he disregards them? Indeed We shall take vengeance upon the guilty.
22.transliteration: wa-man ʾaẓlamu mimman dhukkira bi-ʾāyāti rabbihī thumma ʾaʿraḍa ʿanhā ʾinnā mina l-mujrimīna muntaqimūna

23.content: وَلَقَد آتَينا موسَى الكِتابَ فَلا تَكُن في مِريَةٍ مِن لِقائِهِ ۖ وَجَعَلناهُ هُدًى لِبَني إِسرائيلَ
23.translation_eng: Certainly We gave Moses the Book, [declaring], ‘Do not be in doubt about the encounter with Him,’ and We made it a [source of] guidance for the Children of Israel.
23.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynā mūsā l-kitāba fa-lā takun fī miryatin min liqāʾihī wa-jaʿalnāhu hudan li-banī ʾisrāʾīla

24.content: وَجَعَلنا مِنهُم أَئِمَّةً يَهدونَ بِأَمرِنا لَمّا صَبَروا ۖ وَكانوا بِآياتِنا يوقِنونَ
24.translation_eng: And amongst them We appointed imams to guide [the people] by Our command, when they had been patient and had conviction in Our signs.
24.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā minhum ʾaʾimmatan yahdūna bi-ʾamrinā lammā ṣabarū wa-kānū bi-ʾāyātinā yūqinūna

25.content: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ يَفصِلُ بَينَهُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ فيما كانوا فيهِ يَختَلِفونَ
25.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that about which they used to differ.
25.transliteration: ʾinna rabbaka huwa yafṣilu baynahum yawma l-qiyāmati fī-mā kānū fīhi yakhtalifūna

26.content: أَوَلَم يَهدِ لَهُم كَم أَهلَكنا مِن قَبلِهِم مِنَ القُرونِ يَمشونَ في مَساكِنِهِم ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ ۖ أَفَلا يَسمَعونَ
26.translation_eng: Does it not dawn upon them how many generations We have destroyed before them, amid [the ruins of] whose dwellings they walk? There are indeed signs in that. Will they not then listen?
26.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yahdi lahum kam ʾahlaknā min qablihim mina l-qurūni yamshūna fī masākinihim ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin ʾa-fa-lā yasmaʿūna

27.content: أَوَلَم يَرَوا أَنّا نَسوقُ الماءَ إِلَى الأَرضِ الجُرُزِ فَنُخرِجُ بِهِ زَرعًا تَأكُلُ مِنهُ أَنعامُهُم وَأَنفُسُهُم ۖ أَفَلا يُبصِرونَ
27.translation_eng: Do they not see that We carry water to the parched earth and with it We bring forth crops of which they eat, themselves and their cattle? Will they not then see?
27.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yaraw ʾannā nasūqu l-māʾa ʾilā l-ʾarḍi l-juruzi fa-nukhriju bihī zarʿan taʾkulu minhu ʾanʿāmuhum wa-ʾanfusuhum ʾa-fa-lā yubṣirūna

28.content: وَيَقولونَ مَتىٰ هٰذَا الفَتحُ إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
28.translation_eng: And they say, ‘When will this judgement be, should you be truthful?’
28.transliteration: wa-yaqūlūna matā hādhā l-fatḥu ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

29.content: قُل يَومَ الفَتحِ لا يَنفَعُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا إيمانُهُم وَلا هُم يُنظَرونَ
29.translation_eng: Say, ‘On the day of judgement their [newly found] faith shall not avail the faithless, nor will they be granted any respite.’
29.transliteration: qul yawma l-fatḥi lā yanfaʿu lladhīna kafarū ʾīmānuhum wa-lā hum yunẓarūna

30.translation_eng: So turn away from them, and wait. They too are waiting.

response.description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by The Dawn, and other natural occurrences and sacred designations, as a means of categorical airmation to mankind that God shall, indeed, hold all people accountable. It is names after “the dawn” (al-fajr) mentioned in verse 1. A surah in which God emphasizes that the tyrants of the Prophet’s time will be like those He dealt with in the past. The surah compares the destiny of the ungrateful with that of the souls at peace.The surah is also known as: The Daybreak.

1.translation_eng: By the Dawn,1Interpreted as the month of Muḥarram, which marks the beginning of the year. (Ṭabarī, Taʾrīkh, ii, 390, from Ibn ʿAbbās)

3.translation_eng: by the Even and the Odd,

4.translation_eng: by the night when it departs!

5.content: هَل في ذٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِذي حِجرٍ
5.translation_eng: Is there an oath in that for one possessing intellect?
5.transliteration: hal fī dhālika qasamun li-dhī ḥijrin

6.content: أَلَم تَرَ كَيفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعادٍ
6.translation_eng: Have you not regardedhow your Lord dealt with [the people of] ʿĀd,
6.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara kayfa faʿala rabbuka bi-ʿādin

8.content: الَّتي لَم يُخلَق مِثلُها فِي البِلادِ
8.translation_eng: the like of which was not created among cities,
8.transliteration: allatī lam yukhlaq mithluhā fī l-bilādi

9.translation_eng: and [the people of] Thamūd,who hollowed out the rocks in the valley,

10.translation_eng: and Pharaoh, the impaler,1See the note at 38:12.

11.translation_eng: —those who rebelled [against Allah] in their cities

12.translation_eng: and caused much corruption in them,

13.translation_eng: so your Lord poured on themlashes of punishment.

14.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord is in ambush.

15.content: فَأَمَّا الإِنسانُ إِذا مَا ابتَلاهُ رَبُّهُ فَأَكرَمَهُ وَنَعَّمَهُ فَيَقولُ رَبّي أَكرَمَنِ
15.translation_eng: As for man, whenever his Lord tests himand grants him honour and blesses him,he says, ‘My Lord has honoured me.’
15.transliteration: fa-ʾammā l-ʾinsānu ʾidhā mā btalāhu rabbuhū fa-ʾakramahū wa-naʿʿamahū fa-yaqūlu rabbī ʾakramani

16.content: وَأَمّا إِذا مَا ابتَلاهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيهِ رِزقَهُ فَيَقولُ رَبّي أَهانَنِ
16.translation_eng: But when He tests himand tightens for him his provision,he says, ‘My Lord has humiliated me.’
16.transliteration: wa-ʾammā ʾidhā mā btalāhu fa-qadara ʿalayhi rizqahū fa-yaqūlu rabbī ʾahānani

17.translation_eng: No indeed!Rather you do not honour the orphan,

18.translation_eng: and do not urge the feeding of the needy,

19.translation_eng: and you eat the inheritance rapaciously,

20.translation_eng: and you love wealth with much fondness.

21.content: كَلّا إِذا دُكَّتِ الأَرضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا
21.translation_eng: No indeed!When the earth is levelled1 to a plain,Or ‘crumbled into fragments.’
21.transliteration: kallā ʾidhā dukkati l-ʾarḍu dakkan dakkan

22.translation_eng: and your Lord and the angels arrive in ranks,

23.content: وَجِيءَ يَومَئِذٍ بِجَهَنَّمَ ۚ يَومَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ الإِنسانُ وَأَنّىٰ لَهُ الذِّكرىٰ
23.translation_eng: the day when hell is brought [near],on that day man will take admonitionbut what will the admonition avail him?
23.transliteration: wa-jīʾa yawmaʾidhin bi-jahannama yawmaʾidhin yatadhakkaru l-ʾinsānu wa-ʾannā lahu dh-dhikrā

24.translation_eng: He will say, ‘Alas, had I sent ahead for my life!’

25.translation_eng: On that day none shall punish as He punishes,

26.translation_eng: and none shall bind as He binds.

28.translation_eng: Return to your Lord, pleased, pleasing!

response.description: The surah that is The Opening to the Quran and the straight way of God. Another common name of the surah is The [Lord’s] Praise (al-Ḥamd). It is seen to be a precise table of contents of the Quranic message and is important in Islamic worship, being an obligatory part of the daily prayer, repeated several times during the day.The surah is also known as: The Exordium, The Opening Chapter, The Opening of the Book, The Prologue.

1.translation_eng: In the Name of Allah,the All-beneficent, the All-merciful.

2.translation_eng: All praise belongs to Allah,1Lord of all the worlds,In muslim parlance the phrase al-ḥamdu lillāh also signifies ‘thanks to Allah.’

4.translation_eng: Master1 of the Day of Retribution.This is in accordance with the reading mālik yawm al-dīn, adopted by ʿĀṣim, al-Kisāʾī, Yaʿqūb al-Ḥaḍramī, and Khalaf. Other authorities of qirāʾah (the art of recitation of the Qurʾān) have read ‘malik yawm al-dīn,’ meaning ‘Sovereign of the Day of Retribution’ (see Muʿjam al-Qirāʾāt al-Qurʾāniyyah). Traditions ascribe both readings to Imam Jaʿfar al-Ṣādiq (ʿa). See al-Qummī, al-ʿAyyāshī, Tafsīr al-Imām al-ʿAskarī.

5.translation_eng: You [alone] do we worship,and to You [alone] do we turn for help.

6.translation_eng: Guide us on the straight path,

7.content: صِراطَ الَّذينَ أَنعَمتَ عَلَيهِم غَيرِ المَغضوبِ عَلَيهِم وَلَا الضّالّينَ
7.translation_eng: the path of those whom You have blessed1—such as2 have not incurred Your wrath,3nor are astray.4For further Qurʾānic references to ‘those whom Allah has blessed,’ see 4:69 and 19:58; see also 5:23, 110; 12:6; 27:19; 28:17; 43:59; 48:2.This is in accordance with the qirāʾah of ʿĀṣim, ghayril-maghḍūbi, which appears in the Arabic text above. However, in accordance with an alternative, and perhaps preferable, reading ghayral-maghḍūbi (attributed to Imam ʿAlī b. Abī Ṭālib (ʿa) as well as to Ibn Masʿūd and Ubayy b. Kaʿb among the Companions, and to Ibn Kathīr al-Makkī, among the seven authorities of qirāʾah), the translation will be: ‘not of those who have incurred Your wrath, nor those who are astray.’ (see Muʿjam al-Qirāʾāt al-Qurʾāniyyah).For further references to ‘those who incur Allah’s wrath,’ see 4:93; 5:60; 7:71, 152; 8:16; 16:106; 20:81; 42:16; 48:6; 58:14; 60:13.For further references to ‘those who are astray,’ see 2:108, 175; 3:90; 4:116, 136, 167; 5:12, 60, 77; 6:74, 77, 125, 140; 7:30, 179; 14:3, 18, 27; 15:56; 17:72, 97; 19:38; 22:4, 12; 23:106; 25:44; 28:50; 31:11; 33:36, 67; 34:8; 36:47; 38:26; 39:22; 40:34; 41:52; 42:18; 45:23; 46:5, 32; 60:1.
7.transliteration: ṣirāṭa lladhīna ʾanʿamta ʿalayhim ghayri l-maghḍūbi ʿalayhim wa-lā ḍ-ḍāllīna

{'chapterid': 49}.response: {'id': 49, 'surah_name': 'AL-ḤUJURĀT', 'surah_name_ar': 'الحجرات', 'translation': 'APARTMENTS', 'type': 'medinan', 'total_verses': 18, 'description': 'The surah that criticized as ill-mannered and uncouth those who would stand behind the Apartments of the Prophet’s wives and call him forth for discourse with raised voices. It takes its name from the word “apartments” (ḥujurāt) in verse 4. The surah guides the believers on how to behave with proper respect towards their leader (verse 1 .), and with mutual respect and trust towards each other (verse 9 .). It stresses the unity of mankind and God’s intention that people should live together in harmony (verse 13). It criticizes the desert Arabs for their presumptuous attitude to their faith and to God (verse 14 .).The surah is also known as: The (Inner) Apartments, The Chambers, The Inner Apartments, The Private Quarters, The Private Rooms.', 'verses': {'1': {'id': 1.49, 'content': 'يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تُقَدِّموا بَينَ يَدَيِ اللَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَميعٌ عَليمٌ', 'translation_eng': 'O you who have faith!Do not venture ahead of Allah and His Apostle,and be wary of Allah.Indeed Allah is all-hearing, all-knowing.', 'transliteration': 'yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū lā tuqaddimū bayna yadayi llāhi wa-rasūlihī wa-ttaqū llāha ʾinna llāha samīʿun ʿalīmun'}, '2': {'id': 2.49, 'content': 'يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تَرفَعوا أَصواتَكُم فَوقَ صَوتِ النَّبِيِّ وَلا تَجهَروا لَهُ بِالقَولِ كَجَهرِ
